subject: Temporary fix for lost upstart directory
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 7195, 'name': 'Matthew Mosesohn', 'email': 'raytrac3r@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmosesohn'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-18 12:41:21.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py', 'fuel_agent/manager.py'], 'message': "Temporary fix for lost upstart directory

When we have just os-root fs image and don't have
os-var-log fs image while / and /var/log are supposed to be
separate file systems and os-var-log is mounted into
non-empty directory on the / file system, those files in /var/log
directory become unavailable.
The thing is that among those file there is /var/log/upstart
where upstart daemon writes its logs. We have specific upstart job
which is to flush open files once all file systems are mounted.
This job needs upstart directory to be available on os-var-log
file system.
This is just a temporary fix and correct fix will be available soon
via updates.

Change-Id: Idfea34541e9aabdd22455456c082d78da42657f9
Related-Bug: #1494684
"}]
commit_message:
Temporary fix for lost upstart directory

When we have just os-root fs image and don't have
os-var-log fs image while / and /var/log are supposed to be
separate file systems and os-var-log is mounted into
non-empty directory on the / file system, those files in /var/log
directory become unavailable.
The thing is that among those file there is /var/log/upstart
where upstart daemon writes its logs. We have specific upstart job
which is to flush open files once all file systems are mounted.
This job needs upstart directory to be available on os-var-log
file system.
This is just a temporary fix and correct fix will be available soon
via updates.

Change-Id: Idfea34541e9aabdd22455456c082d78da42657f9
Related-Bug: #1494684

commit_message:
Temporary fix for lost upstart directory

When we have just os-root fs image and don't have
os-var-log fs image while / and /var/log are supposed to be
separate file systems and os-var-log is mounted into
non-empty directory on the / file system, those files in /var/log
directory become unavailable.
The thing is that among those file there is /var/log/upstart
where upstart daemon writes its logs. We have specific upstart job
which is to flush open files once all file systems are mounted.
This job needs upstart directory to be available on os-var-log
file system.
This is just a temporary fix and correct fix will be available soon
via updates.

Change-Id: Idfea34541e9aabdd22455456c082d78da42657f9
Related-Bug: #1494684

commit_message:
Release 2.0.0 of django_openstack_auth

Bumping to 2.0.0 due to missed major bump for python 2.6 drop in
1.3.0 -> 1.4.0

This release has a critical bug fix for Liberty around log in issues
when using Django 1.8. Additionally, WebSSO support has been
improved.

Change-Id: I28fe0d79c56afb1bb5a954680775fb8abe63fbd2

commit_message:
Show public packages for non-admin users

But only if modification of public packages are allowed in policy file.
Turn off managing public packagef for non-admin users by default.

Currently non-admin users are able to see only their own packages
despite of the policy setting.

Corresponding tests were updated.

Change-Id: I5510f6b8b82d7d28358e1b7dcbffe275079512ee
Closes-Bug: #1496418

subject: Fix '_cache_get' multiple keyword argument name overlap
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-09-17 17:24:44.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/tests/unit/test_formatters.py', 'taskflow/formatters.py'], 'message': "Fix '_cache_get' multiple keyword argument name overlap

The argument 'atom_name' is also used by the fetch function
so when it is provided a conflict occurs and this ends badly.

To avoid this capture the needed variables used for fetching
a cached value into a functools.partial object and use that instead
of passing further arguments.

Closes-Bug: #1496608

Change-Id: Ic012f7687037bf876d041c4bc62b3f6606a8a845
"}]
commit_message:
Fix '_cache_get' multiple keyword argument name overlap

The argument 'atom_name' is also used by the fetch function
so when it is provided a conflict occurs and this ends badly.

To avoid this capture the needed variables used for fetching
a cached value into a functools.partial object and use that instead
of passing further arguments.

Closes-Bug: #1496608

Change-Id: Ic012f7687037bf876d041c4bc62b3f6606a8a845

subject: Fix shares CLI for using CGs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-18 12:11:51.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/v1/shares.py', 'manilaclient/tests/unit/v1/test_shell.py', 'manilaclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': "Fix shares CLI for using CGs

For the moment, share can not be neither created with CG nor deleted
if belongs to some CG.
So, add experimental header to 'share create' operation to fix
the former case and update 'delete share' operation to make it support
deletion of shares that belongs to CG in general.

Change-Id: I497a9ab845552fd7e0d66e7352d637c6a86082af
Closes-Bug: #1496518
Closes-Bug: #1497215
"}]
commit_message:
Fix shares CLI for using CGs

For the moment, share can not be neither created with CG nor deleted
if belongs to some CG.
So, add experimental header to 'share create' operation to fix
the former case and update 'delete share' operation to make it support
deletion of shares that belongs to CG in general.

Change-Id: I497a9ab845552fd7e0d66e7352d637c6a86082af
Closes-Bug: #1496518
Closes-Bug: #1497215

The scenario is if the auto-triggered volume
detaching process followed by the VM-deleting process is
failed accidentally, then the volume becomes attached to
an already-deleted VM.

This patch, which is only a work-around of the specified bug, is

Change-Id: I9be744ed185a69cef035b541a0fd7bd2e4aa1855
Closes-Bug: #1335889

commit_message:
Delete volume attached to already-deleted VM

The scenario is if the auto-triggered volume
detaching process followed by the VM-deleting process is
failed accidentally, then the volume becomes attached to
an already-deleted VM.

This patch, which is only a work-around of the specified bug, is
to allow deleting (with force) such volumes.

Change-Id: I9be744ed185a69cef035b541a0fd7bd2e4aa1855
Closes-Bug: #1335889

Now we support 'ZAQAR_MESSAGE' as software_config_transport for nova
server resource, and support 'ZAQAR_SIGNAL' as signal_transport for

Closes-Bug: #1496765

commit_message:
Set 'ZAQAR_MESSAGE', 'ZAQAR_SIGNAL' as a default config option

Now we support 'ZAQAR_MESSAGE' as software_config_transport for nova
server resource, and support 'ZAQAR_SIGNAL' as signal_transport for
software deployment resource, but they are not the choices options in
config.py.

Change-Id: I574b0dad972f5f6d9e2cf1abf4b8fd81a8b9d8b9
Closes-Bug: #1496765

commit_message:
Implement configuration file for kolla-build

Kolla build script configuration now lives in
/etc/kolla/kolla-build.conf.

This allows overriding configuration options without the need to pass
arguments on the command line.

Command line arguments still get precedence.

Closes-Bug: #1496185
Change-Id: I69482a11437087f19d7f76b379dca85b1f622268

subject: Smart root disk selection including support for root device hints
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-09-16 17:22:44.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/test/test_plugins_standard.py', 'ironic_inspector/plugins/standard.py', 'ironic_inspector/conf.py', 'ironic_inspector/test/functional.py', 'setup.cfg', 'example.conf', 'ironic_inspector/test/test_process.py'], 'message': "Smart root disk selection including support for root device hints

Creates a new plugin root_disk_selection which uses root device hints
and IPA inventory to calculate a root disk.

Update scheduler plugin to support 'root_disk' field in introspection
data. This field is populated by both root_disk_selection plugin
and IPA itself. The latter value is now used when root device hints
are not provided.

New option disk_partitioning_spacing regulates whether to substract
1 GiB from local_gb. Previously it was unconditionally done by
the ramdisk.

Change-Id: I8d60e3483ab5d7d181e231fe413fcd16192e0e97
Depends-On: Ie19b82ff2a914873ff4b2395b02643e086b934b1
Implements: blueprint root-device-hints
"}]
commit_message:
Smart root disk selection including support for root device hints

Creates a new plugin root_disk_selection which uses root device hints
and IPA inventory to calculate a root disk.

Update scheduler plugin to support 'root_disk' field in introspection
data. This field is populated by both root_disk_selection plugin
and IPA itself. The latter value is now used when root device hints
are not provided.

New option disk_partitioning_spacing regulates whether to substract
1 GiB from local_gb. Previously it was unconditionally done by
the ramdisk.

commit_message:
gnocchi: add two new resources

This change add instance_network_interface and instance_disk to
Gnocchi dispatcher.

It also adds some missing metadata to samples to build the Gnocchi
resource.

commit_message:
tox: Allow to pass some OS_* variables

New tox version need to list environment variables that are
safe for tests.

This change allows usefull oslotest environment variables:
OS_TEST_TIMEOUT, OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE, OS_STDERR_CAPTURE, OS_LOG_CAPTURE

Change-Id: I422461743560e8eb48f99307198f8565efbca0b3

commit_message:
Adding developer documentation for openstack/networking-sfc

Adding documentation per [1]. A change has been merged to
add a Jenkins job to generate devref documentation from the
networking-sfc repo. As soon as a change is merged into
the networking-sfc repo it should trigger Jenkins to create
documentation at the URL referenced in this change.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#add-link-to-your-developer-documentation

Change-Id: Ife25ef341b77acb3a8c5e6e3cdfac706f36ce8ea
Depends-On: I1fb10c5281eaa240ce92a58d4f8ba015a2f161b1
Depends-On: I20fb684fc9c8932ec1ea083ff9077e668cc2c1cc

commit_message:
Adds network_driver Support of Container Network Model

Adds network_driver to the following:
  1. api baymodel attribute
  2. conductor template definitions and entrypoints
  3. a new column to the baymodel db
  4. objects. Note: Updates baymodel object version
  5. Tests

Partially-Implements: blueprint extend-api-network-attributes
Partially-Implements: blueprint extend-baymodel-net-attributes
Partially-Implements: blueprint conductor-template-net-update

Change-Id: I312ec863919543aa8ca5d215a028d3a44a9003c9

commit_message:
Refactors Heat templates for Container Networking Model

Refactors Heat templates to support multiple container network
implementations through the network_driver parameter. Keeps
Flannel and its associated parameters as-is for backwards
compatibility.

Partially-Implements: blueprint heat-network-refactor
Change-Id: If00adf5db9187b4ade33785bc19becedb4e688a0

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-17 13:23:59.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/conductor/test_template_definition.py'], 'message': 'Fix naming of variables/classes in tests

The names of some of the variables had too much copy-paste, and they
were named k8s even in the mesos and swarm tests. The mesos test was
also named AtomicMesos* even though it was testing the UbuntuMesos
template definition class.

This is super trivial, but staring at these tests made me get irked by
them a little too much.

Change-Id: I863c080a8606992a66d7b517b63982da4caf9798
Closes-Bug: #1496568
'}]
commit_message:
Fix naming of variables/classes in tests

The names of some of the variables had too much copy-paste, and they
were named k8s even in the mesos and swarm tests. The mesos test was
also named AtomicMesos* even though it was testing the UbuntuMesos
template definition class.

This is super trivial, but staring at these tests made me get irked by
them a little too much.

Change-Id: I863c080a8606992a66d7b517b63982da4caf9798
Closes-Bug: #1496568

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-16 14:24:07.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Don't log from _get_stack

_get_stack is called twice during a deployment - once before to
determine whether to create or update, and once at the end to get
the deployed stack.  The logging is only accurate in the first case,
and potentially confusing in the second.

Change-Id: Iafb4234357c6e25956eee69a019b3a9529db9717
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log from _get_stack

_get_stack is called twice during a deployment - once before to
determine whether to create or update, and once at the end to get
the deployed stack.  The logging is only accurate in the first case,
and potentially confusing in the second.

Change-Id: Iafb4234357c6e25956eee69a019b3a9529db9717

subject: Allow selectively disabling resource validation
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-17 16:49:38.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/common.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/tests/generic_resource.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Allow selectively disabling resource validation

For template-validate to use the normal stack.validate code instead
of reimplementing different validation logic, we need to disable
the resource plugin validate() methods, because in nearly all cases
these refer to resource property values, which don't exist at
template-validate time, where parameters aren't mandatory.

We do however want to ensure structural/syntax issues in the resource
definition are caught as early as possible, so add a stack
resource_validate attribute (defaulted to True) which enables selecting
only the resource.Resource superclass validate logic, so we can defer
the full value validation until create without maintaining completely
separate logic.

Change-Id: I501c8c36e923baa8d9b3f0395aaee41f7585ebb1
Partial-Bug: #1467573
"}]
commit_message:
Allow selectively disabling resource validation

For template-validate to use the normal stack.validate code instead
of reimplementing different validation logic, we need to disable
the resource plugin validate() methods, because in nearly all cases
these refer to resource property values, which don't exist at
template-validate time, where parameters aren't mandatory.

We do however want to ensure structural/syntax issues in the resource
definition are caught as early as possible, so add a stack
resource_validate attribute (defaulted to True) which enables selecting
only the resource.Resource superclass validate logic, so we can defer
the full value validation until create without maintaining completely
separate logic.

Change-Id: I501c8c36e923baa8d9b3f0395aaee41f7585ebb1
Partial-Bug: #1467573

subject: Change a response sample in "Create or update metadata item" API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-18 11:36:19.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/v2.1/api_samples/server-metadata/server-metadata-upd-resp.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/v2.1/api_samples/server-metadata/server-metadata-upd-req.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/v2.1/wadl/server-metadata-v2.1.wadl'], 'message': 'Change a response sample in "Create or update metadata item" API

Even in a sample, a request body and a response body should be
consistent.

In "Create or update metadata item" API, because a value of a
request body is "Bar Value", change a value of a response body
to "Bar Value".

For details, please see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#setServerMetadataItem

Change-Id: Ide55a62ffbed03a3bf548f371e883c258b1acc67
Closes-Bug: #1496769
'}]
commit_message:
Change a response sample in "Create or update metadata item" API

Even in a sample, a request body and a response body should be
consistent.

In "Create or update metadata item" API, because a value of a
request body is "Bar Value", change a value of a response body
to "Bar Value".

For details, please see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#setServerMetadataItem

Change-Id: Ide55a62ffbed03a3bf548f371e883c258b1acc67
Closes-Bug: #1496769

heatclient already supplies the files map, as for create/update
but the API and RPC interfaces ignore it.  So wire in the optional
files map, which will enable moving to validation logic which
more closely aligns with the create/update code.

Change-Id: I32a4b8d8c02829398f4792fcb06783ce9233b645
Co-Authored-By: Jay Dobies <jdobies@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: 1467573

commit_message:
Wire in files to template validate

heatclient already supplies the files map, as for create/update
but the API and RPC interfaces ignore it.  So wire in the optional
files map, which will enable moving to validation logic which
more closely aligns with the create/update code.

Change-Id: I32a4b8d8c02829398f4792fcb06783ce9233b645
Co-Authored-By: Jay Dobies <jdobies@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: 1467573

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-15 17:18:22.000000000', 'files': ['elements/deploy-ironic/root.d/00-ironic-deploy-deprecated', 'elements/deploy-ironic/README.rst'], 'message': 'Deprecate the deploy-ironic element

Completed in Kilo the blueprint ipa-as-default-ramdisk [1] ported all
the Ironic drivers in tree to be able to use the IPA ramdisk for the
deployment.

Now in Liberty the blueprint deprecate-bash-ramdisk is deprecating the
bash ramdisk created using the "deploy-ironic" element in DIB.

This patch is printing a deprecation message when the user uses the
"deploy-ironic" element and as well updating the README file to indicate
that it has been deprecated.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/ipa-as-default-ramdisk
[2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/deprecate-bash-ramdisk

Related-Blueprint: deprecate-bash-ramdisk
Change-Id: I8057f52104225326f45eb3ae6065cd02a27f5ef2
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate the deploy-ironic element

Completed in Kilo the blueprint ipa-as-default-ramdisk [1] ported all
the Ironic drivers in tree to be able to use the IPA ramdisk for the
deployment.

Now in Liberty the blueprint deprecate-bash-ramdisk is deprecating the
bash ramdisk created using the "deploy-ironic" element in DIB.

This patch is printing a deprecation message when the user uses the
"deploy-ironic" element and as well updating the README file to indicate
that it has been deprecated.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/ipa-as-default-ramdisk
[2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/deprecate-bash-ramdisk

Related-Blueprint: deprecate-bash-ramdisk
Change-Id: I8057f52104225326f45eb3ae6065cd02a27f5ef2

commit_message:
Release 1.1.0 of keystoneauth

The shade gate is broken pending a release of a bugfix in keystoneauth.
The bugfix in question relates to referring to a class by an incorrect
name. The other patches in the tree are either similar small fixes or
moving around of files in the test tree.

commit_message:
Download a compressed centos cloud images

The centos cloud images are both arround a GB in size, and
downloading them causes lot of CI timeouts, downloading the
compressed version saves 700MB of bandwith and should save
a lot of time.

Change-Id: I8dcd1db81fe5c4661945638ef3e6344fdf651243

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-09-16 03:15:17.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/api/openstack_v1/test_stacks.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/engine/api.py', 'heat/api/openstack/v1/stacks.py', 'heat/engine/service.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_api_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix filter name inconsistency in stack_list

As described in the bug report, filter names used in stack_list API are
not consistent with what users see when creating or retrieving stacks.
We cannot simply change the exposed filter key names because that will
break existing users.

This patch adds a translation logic from STACK_KEYS like 'stack_name' to
its corresponding db column name, i.e. 'name'. The intent is to provide
compatibility with existing use cases while enforcing API consistency
regarding the "properties" a user sees from the API.

At engine API layer, we also try a simple parsing of the 'status' key,
which may be of simple form 'FAILED' or complex form 'CREATE_COMPLETE'.

Change-Id: Ia6fe4345ca9feaf20c3bd020ff454e5d701a458e
Closes-Bug: 1461838
'}]
commit_message:
Fix filter name inconsistency in stack_list

As described in the bug report, filter names used in stack_list API are
not consistent with what users see when creating or retrieving stacks.
We cannot simply change the exposed filter key names because that will
break existing users.

This patch adds a translation logic from STACK_KEYS like 'stack_name' to
its corresponding db column name, i.e. 'name'. The intent is to provide
compatibility with existing use cases while enforcing API consistency
regarding the "properties" a user sees from the API.

At engine API layer, we also try a simple parsing of the 'status' key,
which may be of simple form 'FAILED' or complex form 'CREATE_COMPLETE'.

Change-Id: Ia6fe4345ca9feaf20c3bd020ff454e5d701a458e
Closes-Bug: 1461838

commit_message:
Python 3: Explicitly return parsed args as list

As part of porting to Python 3 parsing of args in "old" Parser
returned 'map' object which in Python 3 returns an iterator.
Now it is converted to list before returning.

Additionally all other failing tests were marked with 'xfail' and
all of them will be run - not only whitelisted.

Change-Id: Idb0683f7449d1ede22e73b80b06fd9508af30f5a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-18 08:27:06.000000000', 'files': ['.mailmap', 'AUTHORS'], 'message': ".mailmap for pbr AUTHORS upate

The AUTHORS file is regenerated by pbr automatically. There are a few
duplicate names in the git log history which caused the file to end up
with duplicates.
Additionaly some person haven't configured their git client to use First
Name / Last Name.

Introduce /.mailmap which pbr reads to alias or combine emails, see for
example:
https://github.com/openstack-dev/pbr/blob/master/.mailmap

When combining email addresses I took the one that had the most commit:

   2 Author: Lakshmi Kannan <lakshmi@stackstorm.com>
   1 Author: Lakshmi Kannan <lakshmi+github@lakshmikannan.me>

  21 Author: Winson Chan <wcchan@stackstorm.com>
   9 Author: Winson Chan <m4d.coder@gmail.com>
   4 Author: W Chan <wcchan@stackstorm.com>

The previous four last entries have been moved to match alphabetical
ordering.

Add myself since this patch is part of the repository.

Change-Id: I46b1e0e97bab87664a1c7a188898e52512b2fdf0
"}]
commit_message:
.mailmap for pbr AUTHORS upate

The AUTHORS file is regenerated by pbr automatically. There are a few
duplicate names in the git log history which caused the file to end up
with duplicates.
Additionaly some person haven't configured their git client to use First
Name / Last Name.

Introduce /.mailmap which pbr reads to alias or combine emails, see for
example:
https://github.com/openstack-dev/pbr/blob/master/.mailmap

When combining email addresses I took the one that had the most commit:

   2 Author: Lakshmi Kannan <lakshmi@stackstorm.com>
   1 Author: Lakshmi Kannan <lakshmi+github@lakshmikannan.me>

  21 Author: Winson Chan <wcchan@stackstorm.com>
   9 Author: Winson Chan <m4d.coder@gmail.com>
   4 Author: W Chan <wcchan@stackstorm.com>

The previous four last entries have been moved to match alphabetical
ordering.

Add myself since this patch is part of the repository.

Change-Id: I46b1e0e97bab87664a1c7a188898e52512b2fdf0

Change-Id: I1e6ef42340f8e380ff99b9d6ca7ea416e0eebfbc
Closes-bug: #1496305"}]
commit_message:
Don't get the image before deleting it

The client currently downloads the image metadata to check if it's deleted
or not. This logic belongs to the server and it's already implemented
there. Instead of getting the image, send the delete request and catch
the 404 error, which is already raised by the server.

Change-Id: I1e6ef42340f8e380ff99b9d6ca7ea416e0eebfbc
Closes-bug: #1496305

commit_message:
Add PRODUCTION: docker-build to astute.yaml

Currently production variable is taken from
version.yaml file. puppet uses this variable
to find out if it is run on the server or
it is just a part of the ISO build process.
This patch is a part of version.yaml
deprecation plan.

Change-Id: I175dc620cbdff3959519e3fc374894f93bba45ac
Implements: bp docker-images-perestroika

subject: Fix the recommendation about file system of Ceph
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-18 03:34:02.000000000', 'files': ['doc/config-reference/block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.xml'], 'message': 'Fix the recommendation about file system of Ceph

The current document mentions that ceph developers recommend btrfs as a
fs for storage, however this is not the case as btrfs is not yet stable
for production clusters and only recommended in not critical
environments.

Change-Id: Ic8a977c6392e49c8516c27ea20374abc02abcb31
Closes-bug: #1491767
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the recommendation about file system of Ceph

The current document mentions that ceph developers recommend btrfs as a
fs for storage, however this is not the case as btrfs is not yet stable
for production clusters and only recommended in not critical
environments.

Change-Id: Ic8a977c6392e49c8516c27ea20374abc02abcb31
Closes-bug: #1491767

commit_message:
Add test for LMA Infrastructure Alerting plugin

This change adds tests for the LMA Infrastructure Alerting [1] plugin.
It deploys also the LMA Collector [2] and the InfluxDB-Grafana [3] plugins
which provide the required source of information for the alert functionality.

[1] https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-plugin-lma-infrastructure-alerting
[2] https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-plugin-lma-collector
[3] https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-plugin-influxdb-grafana

Closes-bug: #1492220

Depends-On: I89eaea46085f73abb4645c39a3ee953da5132009

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-09 14:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['tests/v2/test_images.py', 'glanceclient/v2/schemas.py', 'glanceclient/v2/images.py'], 'message': "Set missing nullable fields

Older versions of Glance's won't return fields that are nullable. This
creates inconsistency between glance responses depending on what fields
are set in the image in the server.

Few patches have landed in the server to allow nullable fields to be
returned from the API. In order to make responses consistent and move
away from older versions of the API, this patch introduces a workaround
that sets such fields that are not returned by older versions of the
API.

The list of fields was taken from the patch that enabled such fields to
be returned in the server: I75da1e9309e0f7ef8839dea3ec9c99c58edc5d63

This list shouldn't be changed/deleted until these versions of the API
are marked as obsolete (or a better solution to this hack is found).

Closes-bug: #1398314
Change-Id: I558bff397d0837bb151993825c11fd0246ed43b5
"}]
commit_message:
Set missing nullable fields

Older versions of Glance's won't return fields that are nullable. This
creates inconsistency between glance responses depending on what fields
are set in the image in the server.

Few patches have landed in the server to allow nullable fields to be
returned from the API. In order to make responses consistent and move
away from older versions of the API, this patch introduces a workaround
that sets such fields that are not returned by older versions of the
API.

The list of fields was taken from the patch that enabled such fields to
be returned in the server: I75da1e9309e0f7ef8839dea3ec9c99c58edc5d63

This list shouldn't be changed/deleted until these versions of the API
are marked as obsolete (or a better solution to this hack is found).

Closes-bug: #1398314
Change-Id: I558bff397d0837bb151993825c11fd0246ed43b5

commit_message:
[docs] Add plugin reference

This patch adds single page that contains
list of all plugins with their description.

In the future next things will be addressed:

- Split this page into few pages, each page should
  contain only specific type of plugins

- Improve descriptions of plugins that we have,
  especially description of context classes

- Add description to base plugin classes that expalins
  how everything works.
  So it won't be hardcoded in plugins.rst and it will
  be possilbe to use it in different places

Change-Id: I87ec6f8497392306578d91263c98c4c035acc521

commit_message:
Enable F812 and H904 style check

There are no shadowed variables in list comprehensions so
F812 can be enabled.
Also enable H904 because it was removed since hacking 0.10.0 [1]

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/hacking/tag/?id=0.10.0

Change-Id: I11e55066f2ec883c5706774d72c4f21b928ebde5

commit_message:
Move import and export backup metadata to object

Encoding and decoding of backup metadata was being done in the backup
driver, but since this is not driver specific data we are talking about
it makes more sense to have this logic in the backup object.

This patch moves the logic to the object while still allowing to have
importing/exporting driver specific backup data, even when this is not
being used at the moment.

Related-Bug: #1455043
Related-Bug: #1476416
Change-Id: I690748e4542880d5e926f3cbf8cedfc86de5cb1f

commit_message:
Create file /etc/default/neutron-server

Some neutron packages do not create the /etc/default/neutron-server
file, so we need to ensure that it exists to prevent errors when the
file_line resource is run.

Closes-bug: #1490438
Change-Id: I612e7fa5da7eebd8ae759e867eb8be5cebcdbe9d
(cherry picked from commit 55930cd62463ef76f4265a003b410e1c69bdfce7)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 19:25:38.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/neutron_agent_linuxbridge/ini_setting.rb'], 'message': 'Fix neutron_agent_linuxbridge file path

Like the ML2 OpenVSwitch agent, the ML2 LinuxBridge agent defines its
config in ml2_conf.ini on Ubuntu. This patch updates the
neutron_agent_linuxbridge provider to behave the same as the
neutron_agent_ovs provider.

Closes-Bug: #1480277

Change-Id: I24462f9d04a07926c05790b80ed5f0064fcef97d
(cherry picked from commit d465022f426cfabb97a499e124c4e6ea288afc84)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron_agent_linuxbridge file path

Like the ML2 OpenVSwitch agent, the ML2 LinuxBridge agent defines its
config in ml2_conf.ini on Ubuntu. This patch updates the
neutron_agent_linuxbridge provider to behave the same as the
neutron_agent_ovs provider.

Closes-Bug: #1480277

Change-Id: I24462f9d04a07926c05790b80ed5f0064fcef97d
(cherry picked from commit d465022f426cfabb97a499e124c4e6ea288afc84)

subject: Port Cisco Nexus/UCSM ExtraConfig to AllNodes
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6620, 'name': 'Abishek Subramanian', 'email': 'absubram@cisco.com', 'username': 'absubram'}, {'_account_id': 6698, 'name': 'Robert Pothier', 'email': 'robpothier35@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpothier'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 14757, 'name': 'Timothy Swanson', 'email': 'tiswanso@cisco.com', 'username': 'tiswanso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-09-17 14:50:53.000000000', 'files': ['environments/neutron-ml2-cisco-nexus-ucsm.yaml', 'puppet/extraconfig/all_nodes/neutron-ml2-cisco-nexus-ucsm.yaml', 'puppet/extraconfig/pre_deploy/controller/network-cisco.yaml'], 'message': 'Port Cisco Nexus/UCSM ExtraConfig to AllNodes

Switch the implemention from a pre_deploy ExtraConfig to an
AllNodesExtraConfig, so we can collect the mac->hostname mapping
for all nodes, then calculate a NexusConfig based on that and
a provided mapping of switch ports to mac address.
The same conversion is also done to the NetworkUCSMHostList:

The port mappings are provided via parameter_defaults like:

parameter_defaults:
  NetworkNexusConfig: {
    "bxb-tor-1": {
      "username": "admin",
      "ssh_port": 22,
      "password": "lab",
      "ip_address": "10.86.7.204",
      "nve_src_intf": 0,
      "physnet": "datacentre",
      "servers": {
        "fa:16:3e:fa:be:ef": "1/11",
        "fa:16:3e:fa:5e:cf": "1/23",
        "fa:16:3e:fa:12:34": "2/34"
      }
    }
  }
  NetworkUCSMHostList: 'fa:16:3e:fa:be:ef:profile1'

This results in an entry like this appended to
/etc/puppet/hieradata/neutron_cisco_data.yaml:

neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::nexus::nexus_config:\
 {"bxb-tor-1": {"username": "admin", "nve_src_intf": 0, "ssh_port": 22,
"servers": {"overcloud-compute02": "2/34", "overcloud-compute01": "1/23",
"overcloud-control01": "1/11"}, "password": "lab", "ip_address": "10.86.7.204",
"physnet": "datacentre"}}
neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::ucsm::ucsm_host_list: overcloud-control01:profile1

Co-Authored-By: Rob Pothier <rpothier@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Swanson <tiswanso@cisco.com>

Change-Id: I372c3ffb6bd85b7239fcb9f3fc4fa51cd4a39332
'}]
commit_message:
Port Cisco Nexus/UCSM ExtraConfig to AllNodes

Switch the implemention from a pre_deploy ExtraConfig to an
AllNodesExtraConfig, so we can collect the mac->hostname mapping
for all nodes, then calculate a NexusConfig based on that and
a provided mapping of switch ports to mac address.
The same conversion is also done to the NetworkUCSMHostList:

The port mappings are provided via parameter_defaults like:

parameter_defaults:
  NetworkNexusConfig: {
    "bxb-tor-1": {
      "username": "admin",
      "ssh_port": 22,
      "password": "lab",
      "ip_address": "10.86.7.204",
      "nve_src_intf": 0,
      "physnet": "datacentre",
      "servers": {
        "fa:16:3e:fa:be:ef": "1/11",
        "fa:16:3e:fa:5e:cf": "1/23",
        "fa:16:3e:fa:12:34": "2/34"
      }
    }
  }
  NetworkUCSMHostList: 'fa:16:3e:fa:be:ef:profile1'

This results in an entry like this appended to
/etc/puppet/hieradata/neutron_cisco_data.yaml:

neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::nexus::nexus_config:\
 {"bxb-tor-1": {"username": "admin", "nve_src_intf": 0, "ssh_port": 22,
"servers": {"overcloud-compute02": "2/34", "overcloud-compute01": "1/23",
"overcloud-control01": "1/11"}, "password": "lab", "ip_address": "10.86.7.204",
"physnet": "datacentre"}}
neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::ucsm::ucsm_host_list: overcloud-control01:profile1

Co-Authored-By: Rob Pothier <rpothier@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Swanson <tiswanso@cisco.com>

Change-Id: I372c3ffb6bd85b7239fcb9f3fc4fa51cd4a39332

subject: Add an ability to manage use_stderr parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 07:03:51.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/ceilometer_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add an ability to manage use_stderr parameter

When logging is already set up, it can be useful to disable this option
to avoid logs duplication (collected by Upstart, for example)

commit_message:
Add "AllNodes" ExtraConfig interface

Adds hook to enable additional "AllNodes" config to be performed prior
to applying puppet - this is useful when you need to build
configuration data which requires knowledge of all nodes in a cluster,
or of the entire deployment.

As an example, there is a sample config template which collects the
hostname and mac addresses for all nodes in the deployment then writes
the data to all Controller nodes.  Something similar to this may be
required to enable creation of the nexus_config in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198754/

There's also another, simpler, example which shows how you could share
the output of an OS::Heat::RandomString between nodes.

Change-Id: I8342a238f50142d8c7426f2b96f4ef1635775509

commit_message:
Remove unused jTweetsAnywhere

jTweetsAnywhere is not used anywhere and if you look at the home page at
http://thomasbillenstein.com/jTweetsAnywhere/, you see that it does not
even work anymore:

	"June 13th, 2013

	jTweetsAnywhere stopped working since Twitter moved from API Version 1.0
	to 1.1 and now turned off V1.0."

Remove it completely, we don't use it and will not use it as is.

Change-Id: I5ab0206907ec3889614860906198c93f868780b6

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 4428, 'name': 'Liyingjun', 'email': 'yinjalee@163.com', 'username': 'liyingjun'}, {'_account_id': 7665, 'name': 'Travis Tripp', 'email': 'os.travis.tripp@gmail.com', 'username': 'travis.tripp'}, {'_account_id': 8040, 'name': 'Timur Sufiev', 'email': 'tsufiev@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsufiev'}, {'_account_id': 11778, 'name': 'Diana Whitten', 'email': 'hurgleburgler@gmail.com', 'username': 'hurgleburgler'}, {'_account_id': 12826, 'name': 'Rob Cresswell', 'display_name': 'robcresswell', 'email': 'robert.cresswell@outlook.com', 'username': 'rob-cresswell'}, {'_account_id': 16769, 'name': 'Lucas Palm', 'email': 'lapalm@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'lucaspalm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-16 20:47:38.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/components/_pie_charts.scss', 'horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.d3piechart.js'], 'message': "Fix angular pie charts appearance

The recent pie charts scss changes made as part of
horizon-theme-css-reorg improved the overall theming capabilities, but
broke a bit layout of pie charts used inside angularized Launch
Instance NG. That's caused by the fact that both types of pie charts
use .pie-chart - but for different subelements. Angular pie chart
marks the top-level chart element with it (the one which contains
title, chart and legend), while legacy pie charts use this class for
the chart's svg. This patch fixes that by renaming the class name of
legacy pie charts both in scss and horizon.d3piechart.js.

Change-Id: Ie803cb7bffdd9cfc508035e16d8e06d284d2f0f0
Closes-Bug: #1493426
"}]
commit_message:
Fix angular pie charts appearance

The recent pie charts scss changes made as part of
horizon-theme-css-reorg improved the overall theming capabilities, but
broke a bit layout of pie charts used inside angularized Launch
Instance NG. That's caused by the fact that both types of pie charts
use .pie-chart - but for different subelements. Angular pie chart
marks the top-level chart element with it (the one which contains
title, chart and legend), while legacy pie charts use this class for
the chart's svg. This patch fixes that by renaming the class name of
legacy pie charts both in scss and horizon.d3piechart.js.

Change-Id: Ie803cb7bffdd9cfc508035e16d8e06d284d2f0f0
Closes-Bug: #1493426

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-16 20:47:08.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/widgets/magic-search/hz-magic-search-bar.spec.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/charts/pie-chart.spec.js'], 'message': "Check element's existence in angular unit tests in a proper way

An assertion `expect(element.find(someSelector)).toBeDefined()` is
always true due to implementation of jQuery selectors. The assertion
that could actually catch something has the form
`expect(element.find(someSelector).length).toBe(1)`.

Change-Id: I52c48e26d87072731f689c136a00a4140a7afb3b
Closes-Bug: #1493354
"}]
commit_message:
Check element's existence in angular unit tests in a proper way

An assertion `expect(element.find(someSelector)).toBeDefined()` is
always true due to implementation of jQuery selectors. The assertion
that could actually catch something has the form
`expect(element.find(someSelector).length).toBe(1)`.

Change-Id: I52c48e26d87072731f689c136a00a4140a7afb3b
Closes-Bug: #1493354

commit_message:
Hide 'Gateway IP' input when 'Disable Gateway' is checked

When updating subnet, 'Gateway IP' input is not hidden if 'Disable
Gateway' checkbox is checked as 'Create Network' wizard do.

Change-Id: Ie6a1dbc645eb566a680a6f6dec316d5077f8645d
Closes-bug: #1484025

commit_message:
[Reports] Add Load Profile chart to report

Process iterations timestamps and display a chart with
number of parallel iterations for each benchmark moment.

Co-Authored-By: Yair Fried <yfried@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aleksandr Maretskiy <amaretskiy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ie902c41b432c09a5e48562ed64b30c75df7f2745

commit_message:
Create puppet-aodh repository

Ceilometer has now its own project for Alarming, that contains
specific configuration files, services, endpoints, etc.

It requires a new Puppet module to be created and be part of
Puppet OpenStack modules.

Source: https://github.com/openstack/aodh
Change-Id: Iaf64f4d1d2e52e671032091efab0494f6ce59a4f

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-26 07:02:13.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/service/edp/oozie/engine.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/service/edp/test_job_manager.py', 'sahara/utils/edp.py', 'sahara/service/edp/job_manager.py'], 'message': 'Job execution cancel timeout

The bug is introduced by change I2cc4309a7b0436506a6e809f2690d9e132c0dc50.

When running edp jobs, we only need to delete job from edp engine if
exceptions are raised after the job run.

Change-Id: I4b5e971edfbceb66c80255a6bfc42ebed0dc0b65
Closes-bug: 1473234
'}]
commit_message:
Job execution cancel timeout

The bug is introduced by change I2cc4309a7b0436506a6e809f2690d9e132c0dc50.

When running edp jobs, we only need to delete job from edp engine if
exceptions are raised after the job run.

Change-Id: I4b5e971edfbceb66c80255a6bfc42ebed0dc0b65
Closes-bug: 1473234

The "oozie_job_id" column in table "job_executions" represents
oozie_job_id only when the edp engine is oozie. When it is spark
engin, oozie_job_id = pid@instance_id, when it is storm engine,
oozie_job_id = topology_name@instance_id.

Rename oozie_job_id to engine_job_id to aviod confusing.

Change-Id: I2671b91a315b2c7a2b805ce4d494252860a7fe6c

commit_message:
Rename oozie_job_id

The "oozie_job_id" column in table "job_executions" represents
oozie_job_id only when the edp engine is oozie. When it is spark
engin, oozie_job_id = pid@instance_id, when it is storm engine,
oozie_job_id = topology_name@instance_id.

Rename oozie_job_id to engine_job_id to aviod confusing.

Change-Id: I2671b91a315b2c7a2b805ce4d494252860a7fe6c
Closes-bug: 1479575

Platform services managed by corosync must not be stopped in maintenance mode:

* p_rabbitmq-server
* p_conntrackd
* p_vrouter

Change-Id: I02663d93121c2087c4b768e60018e64ffd99217b
"}]
commit_message:
Don't stop platform services via corosync

Platform services managed by corosync must not be stopped in maintenance mode:

* p_rabbitmq-server
* p_conntrackd
* p_vrouter

Change-Id: I02663d93121c2087c4b768e60018e64ffd99217b

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-25 11:01:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/backup/api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_backup.py'], 'message': 'Fix backup list all_tenants=0 filtering for admin

When a user with admin role lists backups specifying all_tenants=0 in
the request, it will not behave as expected, it will return backups for
all tenants just as if all_tenants=1 had been specified.

This patch fixes this issue and will only return all tenants in backup
listings if all_tenants is set to a value meaning True (1, true, yes,
y).

Change-Id: Ia74bc258a86f6dc48483dfe17bf5a312aec4058d
Closes-Bug: #1485900
'}]
commit_message:
Fix backup list all_tenants=0 filtering for admin

When a user with admin role lists backups specifying all_tenants=0 in
the request, it will not behave as expected, it will return backups for
all tenants just as if all_tenants=1 had been specified.

This patch fixes this issue and will only return all tenants in backup
listings if all_tenants is set to a value meaning True (1, true, yes,
y).

Change-Id: Ia74bc258a86f6dc48483dfe17bf5a312aec4058d
Closes-Bug: #1485900

Fix FnGetRefId of WaitConditionHandle, ElasticIp and NeutronResource
to fetch value from cache_data, if present.

Change-Id: Icd92f6514c7590c90da2fcd2123d33862d613486

commit_message:
Add barbicanclient clone back (was overzealous in pruning)

I919487f3490f769ffdad036024033e1f991a7ecd correctly removed the extra
barbican clone, but I was overzealous in removing the
python-barbicanclient clone which IS still necessary, because it is not
pulled in by zuul automatically.

Change-Id: Ic28852572f4e2adab9a0e775f82269c588a2a138

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 17:20:41.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py'], 'message': "Prevent stevedore ext errors when glance tests run

When running glance unit tests using run_tests.sh,
there is series of error thrown from stevedore extensions
stating that it cannot load 'swift' module from python-swiftclient.
By default python-swiftclient is not installed by glance and it uses
the file system as it default glance store.

This minor fix helps to avoid the default dependency on 'swift'
module and to load it only when using python-swiftclient just like
its done for other glance stores.

Closes-bug: #1496935
Change-Id: I5936bc19546bc90d863f3e2438f35085f63b1c57
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent stevedore ext errors when glance tests run

When running glance unit tests using run_tests.sh,
there is series of error thrown from stevedore extensions
stating that it cannot load 'swift' module from python-swiftclient.
By default python-swiftclient is not installed by glance and it uses
the file system as it default glance store.

This minor fix helps to avoid the default dependency on 'swift'
module and to load it only when using python-swiftclient just like
its done for other glance stores.

Closes-bug: #1496935
Change-Id: I5936bc19546bc90d863f3e2438f35085f63b1c57

subject: Ban oslo.utils 1.4.1 from kilo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 05:28:41.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Ban oslo.utils 1.4.1 from kilo

In osloutils 1.4.1 was release[1] which includes the g-r caps from juno
stable/kilo This is a valid release according to the kilo g-r

The requirements for Babel are incompatible.

As a quick fix ban 1.4.1 from kilo until a better fix can be found.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/223909/

Change-Id: I15be9e2c81338ac9602ffc8b12de279d1e7cc97e
'}]
commit_message:
Ban oslo.utils 1.4.1 from kilo

In osloutils 1.4.1 was release[1] which includes the g-r caps from juno
stable/kilo This is a valid release according to the kilo g-r

The requirements for Babel are incompatible.

As a quick fix ban 1.4.1 from kilo until a better fix can be found.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/223909/

Change-Id: I15be9e2c81338ac9602ffc8b12de279d1e7cc97e

commit_message:
Allow user to add the description file to sahara image

Sahara-image-elements create a description file for each image.
This description file contains details of elements have been build
into images along with other related infomation.

This is the client side change to allow user to add the description
file to sahara image when do image-register.

commit_message:
Remove the dict check for body[entity_name]

Although VersionedObject provide dictionary key access compat,
it do not support "obj.get(None)".

Also, with the implementation of VersionedObject, the type of
body[entity_name] should be change from dict to VersionedObject.

Change-Id: I965fe36ea43273ebf6283052075e8644000f7fcb

commit_message:
Implement versioned object for share export locations

This is the first object of Manila.

Implementation of oslo.versionedobjects.
Add first object: ShareExportLocation & ShareExportLocationList.
Use the new object instead of direct db_api.

Partially Implements: blueprint versioned-objects

Change-Id: Ia277f6a347a1332a0142ca924ea1c8ed8b3b987c

Now that OS::Heat::TestResource has a _needs_update() method,

commit_message:
Additional unit tests for update-preview

Now that OS::Heat::TestResource has a _needs_update() method,
update-preview correctly shows the resource as "replaced" whenever the
update_replace property is set to true.  Also, add an update_not_allowed
property to OS::Heat::TestResource and a corresponding unit test to test
properties with update_allowed set to False.

Change-Id: I75c4982f0c8eb29ec5ce4287b63ccbb8af25bfef
Partial-Bug: #1494436

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-09-16 21:11:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/controller.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py'], 'message': 'Issue deprecation warning if domain_id not specified in create call

Due to a long-fixed bug in a heat tempest test, we failed to
raise a validation error if a domain_id was not specified in
a create call for a user, group or project. Instead, we tried
the default domain.  This is neither in the spec or what we
want.

Although we would like to remove this, in case any customers
have discovered this undocumented feature, for now we just
issue a deprecation warning, saying that we intend to remove
this is during the N release.

Closes-bug: #1482330
Change-Id: Ib3fe50c49063a64146709e57ddbec6665e64160b
'}]
commit_message:
Issue deprecation warning if domain_id not specified in create call

Due to a long-fixed bug in a heat tempest test, we failed to
raise a validation error if a domain_id was not specified in
a create call for a user, group or project. Instead, we tried
the default domain.  This is neither in the spec or what we
want.

Although we would like to remove this, in case any customers
have discovered this undocumented feature, for now we just
issue a deprecation warning, saying that we intend to remove
this is during the N release.

Closes-bug: #1482330
Change-Id: Ib3fe50c49063a64146709e57ddbec6665e64160b

commit_message:
Fix users/tenants in Neutron job and sample tasks

Nearly all of the tasks in the Neutron job and nearly all of the
Neutron sample tasks had silly numbers of users and tenants, either
far too many (e.g., 25 users for 10 times) or far too few (e.g., one
user for 100 times). This makes them more reasonable and consistent.

Change-Id: I9ab0e8580be490375a30172b3c8dc277de559961

commit_message:
Add SPARK_YARN_HISTORY_SERVER to default templates for cdh

Sahara EDP has been extended to support spark on cdh, so the
default templates should include the spark history server necessary
to run jobs on yarn.

Change-Id: I56fbbd97f52154f78fc5015055a44e20f63838b2
Implements: blueprint spark-jobs-for-cdh-5-3-0

commit_message:
Try to get the version of cloud init via popen

Now we can fail while trying to get the version of cloud-init
via pkg_resources. Try to get the version via ordinary cmd call
'cloud-init --version'.

Change-Id: I39d4d52ba1ac83183a0a46c7f3a70a14b782562a
Closes-Bug: #1481614

commit_message:
Corrected "Network Address" CSS error in "Create Subnet" modal

When click the "next" button while "Network Address" is
blank in "Create Subnet" modal dialog, there will display
"This field is required.", but the string shows css error.
This patch correct the error.

Change-Id: I6bbb3228d17ad971489174532a2ed828bbd77669
Closes-Bug: #1481131

This method had not been updated in a while
to account for changes in the db schema. Also,

rather than iteration as the iteration approach

commit_message:
Refactor and correct purge_deleted

This method had not been updated in a while
to account for changes in the db schema. Also,
it was refactored to use bulk delete statements
rather than iteration as the iteration approach
ran quite a long time and consumed quite a bit
of resources.

Change-Id: Ia49e801d3c244a1fabb8441e7eaa22b88e5fcb56
Closes-Bug: #1439518

commit_message:
Make sure UpdatePolicy is unset for Heat scaling group

It is defined within the properties as rolling_updates.
This patch is to make it more obvious to users that UpdatePolicy
is not supported.

Change-Id: I8162d27036843d0b9282cd8f4aa4d2eb93afba19
Closes-bug: 1423426

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-18 01:23:26.000000000', 'files': ['install_modules.sh'], 'message': 'install keystoneauth1 on rpm based systems

Temporary workaroung to fix a keystoneauth1 packaging issue [1].
Install keystoneauth1 with pip until the package is fixed, so we can
unblock our CI.

[1] https://www.redhat.com/archives/rdo-list/2015-September/msg00155.html

Change-Id: I9681f129181b5a7fc0b04f8490a989e24c75d81a
'}]
commit_message:
install keystoneauth1 on rpm based systems

Temporary workaroung to fix a keystoneauth1 packaging issue [1].
Install keystoneauth1 with pip until the package is fixed, so we can
unblock our CI.

[1] https://www.redhat.com/archives/rdo-list/2015-September/msg00155.html

Change-Id: I9681f129181b5a7fc0b04f8490a989e24c75d81a

commit_message:
Remove existing timeout and increase time

If the original Monasca roles have a timeout set it brakes the
Ceilosca script since there will be two timout set in the same
command.

This patch removes any pre-existing timeout before inserting the
new one set to 600s.

Change-Id: I7ce3c8f360643fdcd57b350cda3270018b7b2d6e
co-author: Steven Irvin <steven.irvin@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Refactor set_configs.py

This refactor brings the logging in line with the rest of Kolla.
The fucntion names were updated to reflect thier new role.

Additionally, it fixes several issues with the permissions which
currently break all containers that use set_configs.py

It will also work with source being a directory or a file now.

Change-Id: I4a197a343e3baf3bd31532debdff5972adb8aefa
Partially-Implements: blueprint replace-config-external

subject: stable/juno: adjust python-ceilometerclient version range
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 16:13:40.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "stable/juno: adjust python-ceilometerclient version range

This is the stable/juno portion of the series to decouple stable/juno
and stable/kilo for python-ceilometerclient.

The adjusted stable/kilo version range is in change
I6791b40a3022cb923ddef4bcf5fb75f9024e07eb. Basically stable/kilo will
use the 1.1.x releases and stable/juno needs to use the 1.0.x releases.

We have to block 1.0.12 since it has uncapped oslo.utils which breaks
with capped oslo.utils from server projects that are synced with
stable/juno g-r, like horizon.

We have to block 1.0.13 and 1.0.14 since those versions have kilo-level
dependent versions which conflict with stable/juno g-r dependent
versions.

The plan is to sync g-r stable/juno to python-ceilometerclient which is
change Iee95922e66b4885f720499d912ff1926019b67c9, and that depends on
this change because otherwise ceilometer on stable/juno requires
python-ceilometerclient<1.0.13 and we can't get
Iee95922e66b4885f720499d912ff1926019b67c9 to pass Jenkins.

Once this change syncs to ceilometer on stable/juno we can get
Iee95922e66b4885f720499d912ff1926019b67c9 to pass CI and release that as
1.0.15, which falls within this range in g-r for stable/juno but won't
fall into the range for stable/kilo g-r.

Whew...

Partial-Bug: #1494516

Change-Id: Ie8151e79928b1cd8a2701b05fc510a36a15a75d1
"}]
commit_message:
stable/juno: adjust python-ceilometerclient version range

This is the stable/juno portion of the series to decouple stable/juno
and stable/kilo for python-ceilometerclient.

The adjusted stable/kilo version range is in change
I6791b40a3022cb923ddef4bcf5fb75f9024e07eb. Basically stable/kilo will
use the 1.1.x releases and stable/juno needs to use the 1.0.x releases.

We have to block 1.0.12 since it has uncapped oslo.utils which breaks
with capped oslo.utils from server projects that are synced with
stable/juno g-r, like horizon.

We have to block 1.0.13 and 1.0.14 since those versions have kilo-level
dependent versions which conflict with stable/juno g-r dependent
versions.

The plan is to sync g-r stable/juno to python-ceilometerclient which is
change Iee95922e66b4885f720499d912ff1926019b67c9, and that depends on
this change because otherwise ceilometer on stable/juno requires
python-ceilometerclient<1.0.13 and we can't get
Iee95922e66b4885f720499d912ff1926019b67c9 to pass Jenkins.

Once this change syncs to ceilometer on stable/juno we can get
Iee95922e66b4885f720499d912ff1926019b67c9 to pass CI and release that as
1.0.15, which falls within this range in g-r for stable/juno but won't
fall into the range for stable/kilo g-r.

Whew...

Partial-Bug: #1494516

Change-Id: Ie8151e79928b1cd8a2701b05fc510a36a15a75d1

commit_message:
WIP: Fix to run v2.1 comp mode tests with v2 sample files

There are some cases where v2.1 is different than v2.0 for example
- VIF net-id
- rate limit bits
- extension info

For above cases, their functional tests has separate sample files
for v2 and v2.1 tests.
As we have tests for v2.1 comp mode also which are supposed to be run
against v2 sample files instead of v2.1 one.

This will make sure v2.1 comp mode behaves same as v2 APIs.

Change-Id: I97bd0562dabc619e15e15ce7f08ee96fa0feea00

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 7404, 'name': 'Ethan Lynn', 'email': 'xuanlangjian@gmail.com', 'username': 'GaryLynn'}, {'_account_id': 8646, 'name': 'yangxurong', 'email': 'yangxurong@huawei.com', 'username': 'yangxurong'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9820, 'name': 'Liping Mao', 'email': 'limao@cisco.com', 'username': 'LipingMao'}, {'_account_id': 16203, 'name': 'zengyingzhe', 'email': 'zengyingzhe@huawei.com', 'username': 'zengyingzhe'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-06-01 11:37:33.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': "Eventlet green threads not released back to pool

Presently, the wsgi server allows persist connections hence even after
the response is sent to the client, it doesn't close the client socket
connection.
Because of this problem, the green thread is not released back to the pool.

In order to close the client socket connection explicitly after the
response is sent and read successfully by the client, you simply have to
set keepalive to False when you create a wsgi server.

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet socket timeout
behaviour. Allows closing idle client connections after a period of
time, eg:

$ time nc localhost 8776
real    1m0.063s
Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact:
Added wsgi_keep_alive option (default=True).
Added client_socket_timeout option (default=900).
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I303d87addeed8b103eeb26dbcc48e3acce06ee6a
Closes-Bug: #1361360
"}]
commit_message:
Eventlet green threads not released back to pool

Presently, the wsgi server allows persist connections hence even after
the response is sent to the client, it doesn't close the client socket
connection.
Because of this problem, the green thread is not released back to the pool.

In order to close the client socket connection explicitly after the
response is sent and read successfully by the client, you simply have to
set keepalive to False when you create a wsgi server.

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet socket timeout
behaviour. Allows closing idle client connections after a period of
time, eg:

$ time nc localhost 8776
real    1m0.063s
Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact:
Added wsgi_keep_alive option (default=True).
Added client_socket_timeout option (default=900).
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I303d87addeed8b103eeb26dbcc48e3acce06ee6a
Closes-Bug: #1361360

subject: Add support for using HTTP POST in VmdkWriteHandle
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 10:22:56.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_vmware/tests/test_rw_handles.py', 'oslo_vmware/rw_handles.py'], 'message': "Add support for using HTTP POST in VmdkWriteHandle

The NFC protocol requires HTTP POST with content type
'application/x-vnd.vmware-streamVmdk' in order to provision virtual
disks in thin format. This patch allows clients to specify the HTTP verb
when using VmdkWriteHandle and thus enables thin provisioning.

Change-Id: Ie11c2bfbbb1ca71e9d35c9407f871214b6aa0e9a
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for using HTTP POST in VmdkWriteHandle

The NFC protocol requires HTTP POST with content type
'application/x-vnd.vmware-streamVmdk' in order to provision virtual
disks in thin format. This patch allows clients to specify the HTTP verb
when using VmdkWriteHandle and thus enables thin provisioning.

Change-Id: Ie11c2bfbbb1ca71e9d35c9407f871214b6aa0e9a

commit_message:
Update hyperlinks from Gerrit to rendered docs

This change replaces links to Gerrit changes with links to the
rendered HTML documentation on docs.openstack.org as well as
minor gramatical nitpicking.

I think we have a chicken and egg situation. The infra change to
enable docs generation [1] has been merged but the docs aren't
in the expected location [2] yet. I think this is because the
Jenkins job will only run when a change is merged and nothing
has been merged in the networking-sfc repo since the infra
change. I believe that merging this change should trigger the
Jenkins job which will create [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/221589/
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/networking-sfc/portchain-ovs-driver-agent.html

Change-Id: I20fb684fc9c8932ec1ea083ff9077e668cc2c1cc

This change adds cinder API application, so cinder API can be run
under wsgi server(Apache, Nginx, etc). Eventlet will still be used
by default.

Cinder API with eventlet as a webserver and wsgi application
managing has some cons:

* Cinder API is deployed in other way as a common web application.
Apache/Nginx is generally used web servers for REST API application.

* Cinder API is run as a separate service. It means that cloud
operators need to configure some software to monitor that the API
is running.

* Apache/Nginx works better under the real heavy load than eventlet.

To use c-api deployment under Apache in devstack assign
devstack var CINDER_USE_MOD_WSGI="True".
Related changes in devstack:
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/204643/

Cinder documentation on how deploy cinder API under Apache:
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/207020/

Patch for Infra to make it tested:
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/208498/

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint: non-eventlet-wsgi-app

Change-Id: If877d700b0efaa5406efa8f8f17c5816928e83ce
'}]
commit_message:
Add Cinder API wsgi application

This change adds cinder API application, so cinder API can be run
under wsgi server(Apache, Nginx, etc). Eventlet will still be used
by default.

Cinder API with eventlet as a webserver and wsgi application
managing has some cons:

* Cinder API is deployed in other way as a common web application.
Apache/Nginx is generally used web servers for REST API application.

* Cinder API is run as a separate service. It means that cloud
operators need to configure some software to monitor that the API
is running.

* Apache/Nginx works better under the real heavy load than eventlet.

To use c-api deployment under Apache in devstack assign
devstack var CINDER_USE_MOD_WSGI="True".
Related changes in devstack:
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/204643/

Cinder documentation on how deploy cinder API under Apache:
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/207020/

Patch for Infra to make it tested:
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/208498/

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint: non-eventlet-wsgi-app

Change-Id: If877d700b0efaa5406efa8f8f17c5816928e83ce

Compute v2.1 docs clean up (part10) (os-volumes, os-snapshots)

Add os-volumes, os-snapshots

p.s.
  os-snapshots are not listed in launchpad bug report.

Keystonemiddleware's auth_token _v3_to_v2_catalog conversion is
dropping the id portion of the catalog during the conversion. This

Closes-Bug: #1421858

commit_message:
v3 to v2 catalog conversion missing id

Keystonemiddleware's auth_token _v3_to_v2_catalog conversion is
dropping the id portion of the catalog during the conversion. This
makes sure the id is carried over.

Change-Id: If6f6d21bc1f0a1cacdfd636b249e00832bc54bd1
Closes-Bug: #1421858

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 22:27:30.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/tests/unit/v1/test_search.py', 'searchlight/api/v1/search.py'], 'message': 'Raise on RBAC error

commit_message:
Raise on RBAC error

Raises an InternalServerError on a problem creating the RBAC filter
rather than silently failing and allowing the search to continue.

Change-Id: I33878096f628be0e0e1af1466f6d44cd253c8a2e
Closes-Bug: #1492112

name accordingly.

Changes:

1) Updated from global requirements

2) Updated "run_tests.sh" script to be able to run unit tests
using Django 1.8.* removing "--verbosity" opt.

3) Added tox jobs 'py27dj17' and 'py27dj18' to be able to run
unit tests for Django 1.7.* and 1.8.* in separate envs.

commit_message:
Updated requirements and unit tests config

Changes:

1) Updated from global requirements

2) Updated "run_tests.sh" script to be able to run unit tests
using Django 1.8.* removing "--verbosity" opt.

3) Added tox jobs 'py27dj17' and 'py27dj18' to be able to run
unit tests for Django 1.7.* and 1.8.* in separate envs.

Change-Id: I267c8e7a6cb8d67d7331f4f00cb79ad98832d0e7
Closes-Bug: #1496412

Removed bullets from example architectures

Removed bullets from the example architectures. Content has been rearranged
into logical paragraph under headings for each example.

Left aligned notes to avoid unnecessary blockquote.
Intended notes 2 spaces to fix build error.

commit_message:
[security-guide] Ephemeral encryption setup

The Data Encryption section in the OpenStack security guide needs
some info added to describe how to enable ephemeral disk encryption.

commit_message:
Revert "Pecan WSGI: prevent plugins from opening AMQP connections"

This reverts commit 2ba2456f9dae2a4cf30804a562c08832c24b6231
because it has a conflict with upstream commit
9f6bd17703b7286be9e7d439d15f4dec2774e13a. We need to merge
master into pecan with this reverted and then revert the revert
and resolve the conflict there so we don't have any conflict
resolutions in merge commits.

Change-Id: I22388de076cbd90da33502249e101749e019e0cb

subject: Extend the state machine spec to cover DEPLOYWAIT and abort
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 10:10:56.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo-implemented/new-ironic-state-machine.rst'], 'message': 'Extend the state machine spec to cover DEPLOYWAIT and abort

This patches extend the state machine spec to cover the DEPLOYWAIT state
that was missing and also to talk abort "abort" verb that is being
introduced to the CLEANWAIT state.

The API verb was also corrected, in the API the verb to delete an
instance is "deleted" (for historical reasons) and not "delete".

Change-Id: Id3f7d39027bff43a336cfcdeaf6ba18d6463be51
'}]
commit_message:
Extend the state machine spec to cover DEPLOYWAIT and abort

This patches extend the state machine spec to cover the DEPLOYWAIT state
that was missing and also to talk abort "abort" verb that is being
introduced to the CLEANWAIT state.

The API verb was also corrected, in the API the verb to delete an
instance is "deleted" (for historical reasons) and not "delete".

Change-Id: Id3f7d39027bff43a336cfcdeaf6ba18d6463be51

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-16 21:22:02.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/base.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/test_fixedips.py'], 'message': "Show reserved status for a fixed_ip if available

Commit 8886590f30daf736ae30a95b3e4a77cb586d4f02 adds the v2.4
microversion to nova so that we can get back the reserved value of a
fixed IP.

This change adds support to novaclient to display the reserved status
from the fixed_ip resource if it's available in the response.

Change-Id: Idf3df1728ba87006d1b0f82a1c01712202670e0a
"}]
commit_message:
Show reserved status for a fixed_ip if available

Commit 8886590f30daf736ae30a95b3e4a77cb586d4f02 adds the v2.4
microversion to nova so that we can get back the reserved value of a
fixed IP.

This change adds support to novaclient to display the reserved status
from the fixed_ip resource if it's available in the response.

Related blueprint show-reserved-status-in-os-fixed-ips-api

Change-Id: Idf3df1728ba87006d1b0f82a1c01712202670e0a

commit_message:
VMware: create method for getting datacenter from datastore

The method previously defined in vmops was factored out to be a
utility method. This is to enable us to use this in additional
classes.

subject: Pass block_device_info when delete an encrypted lvm
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 8213, 'name': 'Claudiu Belu', 'email': 'claudiu.belu@canonical.com', 'username': 'claudiub'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11303, 'name': 'Markus Zoeller (markus_z)', 'email': 'mzoeller@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'mzoeller'}, {'_account_id': 12175, 'name': 'Eli Qiao', 'email': 'qiaoliyong@gmail.com', 'username': 'Eli'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16897, 'name': 'Virtuozzo Storage CI', 'email': 'vzstorage-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'vzstorage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-28 03:37:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Pass block_device_info when delete an encrypted lvm

This is a regression bug, in Ifb20655c32896b640672917e3840add81b136780,
we made get_instance_disk_info() conservative, it requires block_device_info
if disk_type is `block`.

But currently, in _detach_encrypted_volumes, we don't pass bdi when calling
get_instance_disk_info, so it returns nothing, and nova doesn't delete the
encryptor volume, and failed to delete the lvm when deleting instance.

Co-Authored-By: LisaLi <xiaoyan.li@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1486880
Change-Id: Ibc7e4a3c0e98dc70f7bd30d789069ba27eec7d76
"}]
commit_message:
Pass block_device_info when delete an encrypted lvm

This is a regression bug, in Ifb20655c32896b640672917e3840add81b136780,
we made get_instance_disk_info() conservative, it requires block_device_info
if disk_type is `block`.

But currently, in _detach_encrypted_volumes, we don't pass bdi when calling
get_instance_disk_info, so it returns nothing, and nova doesn't delete the
encryptor volume, and failed to delete the lvm when deleting instance.

Co-Authored-By: LisaLi <xiaoyan.li@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1486880
Change-Id: Ibc7e4a3c0e98dc70f7bd30d789069ba27eec7d76

commit_message:
Fix string formatting in api/metadata/vendordata_json.py

The string format should be "%(logprefix)s", add the missing "s" in one
case.

The strings currently do not include a space after the "s" which
confuses translators.  Add the space and remove it from logprefix.

Change-Id: I6b3113e184c9c3cee1e2ebe448655c7488efb61b
Closes-Bug: #1496273

Currently, the query to quota usage table is not order
preserved. This might cause deadlock in large-scale
deployment: different calls may lock rows in different
order, and deadlock will happen.

This patch adds order_by to the query and make the query
to the table order preserved.

Change-Id: I98f6d7c3141349326c43cb32adcc1e6485ad53a6
Closes-bug: #1485408
'}]
commit_message:
Make query to quota usage table order preserved

Currently, the query to quota usage table is not order
preserved. This might cause deadlock in large-scale
deployment: different calls may lock rows in different
order, and deadlock will happen.

This patch adds order_by to the query and make the query
to the table order preserved.

Change-Id: I98f6d7c3141349326c43cb32adcc1e6485ad53a6
Closes-bug: #1485408

commit_message:
ovs: don't use ARP responder for IPv6 addresses

ARP does not support IPv6 addresses, so when we try to apply the flow, it
fails, with all other flows deferred for the same transaction. It results in
random flow breakages, depending on the order of the bad flow in the
transaction.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I0ecf167653e5a7d0916e091e05050406a026a1e2
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Carroll <Thomas.Carroll@pnnl.gov>
Closes-Bug: #1477253
(cherry picked from commit a19e64c9d95781982d28113c667dbc90d0ea11eb)

When creating VMs, the DVR router will broadcast VM's arp details to all
the l3 agents hosting it. That can enable DVR to forward networking traffic
in link layer, but when the port is attached to a service like lbaas,
its arp will not be broadcast, since DVR does not know the port's mac,
it will prevent VMs in other subnets from reaching the service port.

(cherry picked from commit 85ebf88afa04986cd0e5d65f20c9f286820d87a5)
"}]
commit_message:
Broadcast service port's arp in DVR

When creating VMs, the DVR router will broadcast VM's arp details to all
the l3 agents hosting it. That can enable DVR to forward networking traffic
in link layer, but when the port is attached to a service like lbaas,
its arp will not be broadcast, since DVR does not know the port's mac,
it will prevent VMs in other subnets from reaching the service port.

Change-Id: Ia78a35f39981d6659fc220e02fb10917bda74e04
Closes-Bug: #1481613
(cherry picked from commit 85ebf88afa04986cd0e5d65f20c9f286820d87a5)

commit_message:
Attaching enhancement for EMC VNX driver

Remove the lun list command after adding the lun into a storage
group. This could improve the performance of initialize connection.

Closes-Bug: #1495806

This is a preparation patch for enabling live migration with
serial console, which will introduce a new user of
get_serial_ports_for_guest().

Move the get_guest call to the caller of
get_serial_ports_for_guest() to avoid the generation of an
exception in a generator.

Change-Id: Ice0a81e576313732d742926c4c05d8251e6ca6d5
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: use guest as parameter for get serial ports

This is a preparation patch for enabling live migration with
serial console, which will introduce a new user of
get_serial_ports_for_guest().

Move the get_guest call to the caller of
get_serial_ports_for_guest() to avoid the generation of an
exception in a generator.

Change-Id: Ice0a81e576313732d742926c4c05d8251e6ca6d5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-04 01:45:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Clarify max_local_block_devices config option usage

The previous wording for the max_local_block_devices config option made
it sound like if you set it to 0 that you could restrict to only booting
instances from volumes, which is not the case - but is apparently
something that some operators want (this came up in the related bug and
in IRC).

This updates the help text with a description that ndipanov put in the
bug report which makes the 0 case more clear.

Co-Authored-By: Nikola Dipanov <ndipanov@redhat.com>

Related-Bug: #1436314

Change-Id: I01a9e2f193b50285966690efd771da432a7ad40c
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify max_local_block_devices config option usage

The previous wording for the max_local_block_devices config option made
it sound like if you set it to 0 that you could restrict to only booting
instances from volumes, which is not the case - but is apparently
something that some operators want (this came up in the related bug and
in IRC).

This updates the help text with a description that ndipanov put in the
bug report which makes the 0 case more clear.

Co-Authored-By: Nikola Dipanov <ndipanov@redhat.com>

Related-Bug: #1436314

Change-Id: I01a9e2f193b50285966690efd771da432a7ad40c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 15:42:46.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/notification.py'], 'message': "do not recreate main queue listeners on partitioning

when we have workload partitioning enabled, we kill and recreate
the main queue listeners whenever an agent is added or dropped.
this isn't necessary and also adds significant overhead to
rebalancing logic. this patch changes it to just reconfigure
pipeline queues.

Change-Id: I81953239f2dd1fa610762f01a7a17653242db53e
Closes-Bug: #1496442
"}]
commit_message:
do not recreate main queue listeners on partitioning

when we have workload partitioning enabled, we kill and recreate
the main queue listeners whenever an agent is added or dropped.
this isn't necessary and also adds significant overhead to
rebalancing logic. this patch changes it to just reconfigure
pipeline queues.

Change-Id: I81953239f2dd1fa610762f01a7a17653242db53e
Closes-Bug: #1496442
