subject: Remove SQL GET request from UpdateAmphoraComputeId
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-17 08:33:35.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/controller/worker/tasks/database_tasks.py'], 'message': 'Remove SQL GET request from UpdateAmphoraComputeId

"UpdateAmphoraComputeId" task actually return an object and perform
a SQL request not used by any taskflow.
"UpdateAmphoraComputeId" task usage in amphora_flows doesn't
provides anything. Hence SQL request and return value can be avoided.

Change-Id: I93eca3193435fd59fc2d73fc1d820ae51fde3e03
'}]
commit_message:
Remove SQL GET request from UpdateAmphoraComputeId

"UpdateAmphoraComputeId" task actually return an object and perform
a SQL request not used by any taskflow.
"UpdateAmphoraComputeId" task usage in amphora_flows doesn't
provides anything. Hence SQL request and return value can be avoided.

Change-Id: I93eca3193435fd59fc2d73fc1d820ae51fde3e03

subject: Added a whitelist for restricting the StatsD metrics
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2419, 'name': 'Roland Hochmuth', 'email': 'roland.hochmuth@hpe.com', 'username': 'roland-hochmuth-s'}, {'_account_id': 11094, 'name': 'Tim Kuhlman', 'email': 'timothy.kuhlman@canonical.com', 'username': 'kuhlmant'}, {'_account_id': 11809, 'name': 'Craig Bryant', 'email': 'craig.bryant@hpe.com', 'username': 'craig-bryant'}, {'_account_id': 12149, 'name': 'Dexter Fryar', 'email': 'dexter.fryar@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dlfryar'}, {'_account_id': 12512, 'name': 'Deklan Dieterly', 'email': 'deklan.dieterly@hpe.com', 'username': 'deklan'}, {'_account_id': 15027, 'name': 'Michael Hoppal', 'email': 'michael.jam.hoppal@hpe.com', 'username': 'michael-hoppal'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-08-28 22:18:11.000000000', 'files': ['thresh/src/main/java/monasca/thresh/utils/StatsdConfig.java', 'thresh/src/main/java/monasca/thresh/TopologyModule.java', 'thresh/src/main/config/thresh-sample-config.yml', 'thresh/src/main/java/monasca/thresh/utils/StatsdMetricConsumer.java'], 'message': 'Added a whitelist for restricting the StatsD metrics

A whitelist and metric map for the metrics that are
sent by Storm / Threshold Engine to the Monasca
StatsD agent/daemon.

Also relates to:
  https://github.com/hpcloud-mon/ansible-monasca-thresh/pull/14

=======

/etc/monasca/thresh-config.yml

```
statsdConfig:
  host: localhost
  port: 8125
  debugmetrics: false
  dimensions: !!map
    service : monitoring
    component : storm
  whitelist: !!seq
    - aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_alarm-creation-stream
    - aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_default
    - aggregation-bolt.execute-count.system_tick
    - filtering-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_metric-alarm-events
    - filtering-bolt.execute-count.metrics-spout_default
    - thresholding-bolt.execute-count.aggregation-bolt_default
    - thresholding-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_alarm-definition-events
    - system.memory_heap.committedBytes
    - system.memory_nonHeap.committedBytes
    - system.newWorkerEvent
    - system.startTimeSecs
    - system.GC_ConcurrentMarkSweep.timeMs
  metricmap: !!map
    aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_alarm-creation-stream :
      monasca_threshold.aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_alarm-creation-stream
    aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_default :
      monasca_threshold.aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_default
    aggregation-bolt.execute-count.system_tick :
      monasca_threshold.aggregation-bolt.execute-count.system_tick
    filtering-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_metric-alarm-events :
      monasca_threshold.filtering-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_metric-alarm-events
    filtering-bolt.execute-count.metrics-spout_default :
      monasca_threshold.filtering-bolt.execute-count.metrics-spout_default
    thresholding-bolt.execute-count.aggregation-bolt_default :
      monasca_threshold.thresholding-bolt.execute-count.aggregation-bolt_default
    thresholding-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_alarm-definition-events :
      monasca_threshold.thresholding-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_alarm-definition-events
    system.memory_heap.committedBytes :
      monasca_threshold.system.memory_heap.committedBytes
    system.memory_nonHeap.committedBytes :
      monasca_threshold.system.memory_nonHeap.committedBytes
    system.newWorkerEvent :
      monasca_threshold.system.newWorkerEvent
    system.startTimeSecs :
      monasca_threshold.system.startTimeSecs
    system.GC_ConcurrentMarkSweep.timeMs :
      monasca_threshold.system.GC_ConcurrentMarkSweep.timeMs
```

host: IP or host where the Monasca Agent running a StatsD is running that will consume
      the metrics produced by Storm / Threshold Engine

port: UDP port number where the Monasca Agent running a StatsD daemon that will consume
      the metrics produced by Storm / Threshold Engine

dimensions: A map of key/value pairs that will be passed along as dimensions for each metric

whitelist: A list of metrics in the native name that Storm presents

metricmap: A mapping from the native Storm metric name to a user defined name.  The user
           defined name is what will appear in the Monasca data store.  If there is no
           mapping present and it is listed in the whitelist then it will be published
           with the native name. The 12 metrics whitelisted/mapped above correspond to the
           monasca health dashboard which is defined in grafana.

           https://github.com/hpcloud-mon/grafana/blob/master/src/app/dashboards/monasca.json

Change-Id: I7bcefd03d02714ac42efd9b2d9cadb77907fa17e
'}]
commit_message:
Added a whitelist for restricting the StatsD metrics

A whitelist and metric map for the metrics that are
sent by Storm / Threshold Engine to the Monasca
StatsD agent/daemon.

Also relates to:
  https://github.com/hpcloud-mon/ansible-monasca-thresh/pull/14

=======

/etc/monasca/thresh-config.yml

```
statsdConfig:
  host: localhost
  port: 8125
  debugmetrics: false
  dimensions: !!map
    service : monitoring
    component : storm
  whitelist: !!seq
    - aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_alarm-creation-stream
    - aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_default
    - aggregation-bolt.execute-count.system_tick
    - filtering-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_metric-alarm-events
    - filtering-bolt.execute-count.metrics-spout_default
    - thresholding-bolt.execute-count.aggregation-bolt_default
    - thresholding-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_alarm-definition-events
    - system.memory_heap.committedBytes
    - system.memory_nonHeap.committedBytes
    - system.newWorkerEvent
    - system.startTimeSecs
    - system.GC_ConcurrentMarkSweep.timeMs
  metricmap: !!map
    aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_alarm-creation-stream :
      monasca_threshold.aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_alarm-creation-stream
    aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_default :
      monasca_threshold.aggregation-bolt.execute-count.filtering-bolt_default
    aggregation-bolt.execute-count.system_tick :
      monasca_threshold.aggregation-bolt.execute-count.system_tick
    filtering-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_metric-alarm-events :
      monasca_threshold.filtering-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_metric-alarm-events
    filtering-bolt.execute-count.metrics-spout_default :
      monasca_threshold.filtering-bolt.execute-count.metrics-spout_default
    thresholding-bolt.execute-count.aggregation-bolt_default :
      monasca_threshold.thresholding-bolt.execute-count.aggregation-bolt_default
    thresholding-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_alarm-definition-events :
      monasca_threshold.thresholding-bolt.execute-count.event-bolt_alarm-definition-events
    system.memory_heap.committedBytes :
      monasca_threshold.system.memory_heap.committedBytes
    system.memory_nonHeap.committedBytes :
      monasca_threshold.system.memory_nonHeap.committedBytes
    system.newWorkerEvent :
      monasca_threshold.system.newWorkerEvent
    system.startTimeSecs :
      monasca_threshold.system.startTimeSecs
    system.GC_ConcurrentMarkSweep.timeMs :
      monasca_threshold.system.GC_ConcurrentMarkSweep.timeMs
```

host: IP or host where the Monasca Agent running a StatsD is running that will consume
      the metrics produced by Storm / Threshold Engine

port: UDP port number where the Monasca Agent running a StatsD daemon that will consume
      the metrics produced by Storm / Threshold Engine

dimensions: A map of key/value pairs that will be passed along as dimensions for each metric

whitelist: A list of metrics in the native name that Storm presents

metricmap: A mapping from the native Storm metric name to a user defined name.  The user
           defined name is what will appear in the Monasca data store.  If there is no
           mapping present and it is listed in the whitelist then it will be published
           with the native name. The 12 metrics whitelisted/mapped above correspond to the
           monasca health dashboard which is defined in grafana.

           https://github.com/hpcloud-mon/grafana/blob/master/src/app/dashboards/monasca.json

Change-Id: I7bcefd03d02714ac42efd9b2d9cadb77907fa17e

commit_message:
Adding an OSSN for bug 1457551 - django session store DoS

A bug in Django that affects versions of Horizon pre-Kilo allows
an attacker to potentially DoS Horizon by filling the session
store database.

Closes-Bug #1457551
Change-Id: I2d151992a9da947ed1a70e15619faaeece943da7
Co-Authored-By: Michael Xin <michael.xin@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix nova bash-completion needs authentication

  CLI-Reference generator requires
   (openstack-doc-tools/bin/doc-tools-update-cli-reference)
  that command line help and bash-completion running without authentication.

  For this purpose, remove authentication check in command and its test.
    Fix nova bash-completion works without authentication.
    Fix nova bash-completion test without setting authentication infomation.

  Define skip_auth for descriminate "nova bash-completion" and do_help.

Change-Id: Ic1a7f84b1b9cb7e8be6721c1b8096f49e9e9ab33
Closes-Bug: #1495424

subject: Fix alternating status when status is "None"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-16 21:56:15.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_dbaas.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/service.py'], 'message': 'Fix alternating status when status is "None"

- Instance status would still alternate because the status
would be None and the guest agent heartbeat would set the
status to ACTIVE before the prepare would get called.
- Added check if self.status is None when and force
is False. This will ensure the heartbeat will be skipped.
- Added SHUTDOWN status as a FORCE heartbeat status. This
ensures resize_instance will work.
- Added force=True to begin_install because we always want
to set the status to BUILDING when prepare is started.
- Added unit test to cover new None case.

Change-Id: Ia7d8ef3a4973b990c695262b21fb5d36088efb1b
Closes-Bug: 1482795
'}]
commit_message:
Fix alternating status when status is "None"

- Instance status would still alternate because the status
would be None and the guest agent heartbeat would set the
status to ACTIVE before the prepare would get called.
- Added check if self.status is None when and force
is False. This will ensure the heartbeat will be skipped.
- Added SHUTDOWN status as a FORCE heartbeat status. This
ensures resize_instance will work.
- Added force=True to begin_install because we always want
to set the status to BUILDING when prepare is started.
- Added unit test to cover new None case.

Change-Id: Ia7d8ef3a4973b990c695262b21fb5d36088efb1b
Closes-Bug: 1482795

commit_message:
Rename 'fields' to '_source'

Renames the search 'fields' attribute to '_source' to match the
elasticsearch (and python-elasticsearch) APIs. Refactors the ES
gateway a bit to pass kwargs through since there was some default
argument translation that will get out of hand.

Change-Id: I5d5d3f3cb30e0441dea86b2fe707825966288fba
Closes-Bug: #1493586

commit_message:
Localization framework in neutron is not working correctly

Currently in Stable/Juno only neutron-log-info.po file is present for
neutron code but the code is using neutron as domain.
Also locale directory to use is being fetched from environment
which is not set, hence locale files are not located using
gettext utility successfully.
Closes-Bug: #1441982

Change-Id: If858ac4840a6e921b0c0d9fdc9bdee3827c0df22

commit_message:
Refactor the _get_external_device_interface_name method

Currently this method does two things. It returns the
external interface name as its name indicates and
creates some interfaces in the case of the dvr mode.
This patch split these two things into two methods and
refactor a bit the code according to this change.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
	neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py

(cherry-picked from 6e5762be5b3324f1cf0e52f2680455d760bcc3ea)
Related-Bug: #1375994
Change-Id: I7dc2c03457cbb209c84584c2badffd12048e9617

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-18 12:04:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Initialize dist_fip_count after agent restart

Runtime router variable dist_fip_count has been
used to keep track of FIPs for DVR routers.
This variable is not re-initialized correctly on
agent restart and can get stale from other errors
which cause problems with namespace and port cleanup.

This patch will initialize the ri.dist_fip_count
once in process_router for dvr routers only.  This
method was selected instead of the _router_added or
_router_removed path because it is the one central
entry point for rotuer add, delete, and update.

The object self.agent_gateway_port also needs to be
properly handled after an agent restart and this
patch will handle that as well.

When needed, the system will be read via system
calls to determine the state of namespaces and ports
since the variables cannot be relied on.
System calls will be kept to a minimum to reduce
and possible performance hits.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr.py
	neutron/services/vpn/device_drivers/__init__.py
	neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py

(cherry-picked from ee4bae211309e0f1fcee5565ddd2379997e1de13)
Change-Id: Iae5ebf5249f8e16ab57df78e042293ca2855ddf1
Closes-bug: #1367039
'}]
commit_message:
Initialize dist_fip_count after agent restart

Runtime router variable dist_fip_count has been
used to keep track of FIPs for DVR routers.
This variable is not re-initialized correctly on
agent restart and can get stale from other errors
which cause problems with namespace and port cleanup.

This patch will initialize the ri.dist_fip_count
once in process_router for dvr routers only.  This
method was selected instead of the _router_added or
_router_removed path because it is the one central
entry point for rotuer add, delete, and update.

The object self.agent_gateway_port also needs to be
properly handled after an agent restart and this
patch will handle that as well.

When needed, the system will be read via system
calls to determine the state of namespaces and ports
since the variables cannot be relied on.
System calls will be kept to a minimum to reduce
and possible performance hits.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr.py
	neutron/services/vpn/device_drivers/__init__.py
	neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py

(cherry-picked from ee4bae211309e0f1fcee5565ddd2379997e1de13)
Change-Id: Iae5ebf5249f8e16ab57df78e042293ca2855ddf1
Closes-bug: #1367039

commit_message:
Unregister some configuration options after test

Configuraiton opitons in KSM's testcase is not registered by
oslo_config.fixture.Config, so it will no be unregistered after
testcases, this requires us to clean these options by ourselves.

In this patch, we clean these options which has been registered
more than one times with different value since they will cause
DuplicateOptError exceptions.

Co-Authored-By: Lin Hua Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I5f2a348460d44b8e24cdaaeaebe66b510e7a6255
Closes-Bug: #1494327

commit_message:
Replace urllib.unquote with urllib.parse.unquote

This patch replaces urllib.unquote with urllib.parse.unquote
in the vmdk driver.

Commit d08c7ffe52e3ee211e425c363200998704726e58 replaced
urllib and urllib2 with six.moves.urllib and changed urllib.
unquote to urllib.parse.unquote but missed one call site
in the vmdk driver since the code which introduced it was
under review at the same time. Due to this, if we set an
optional parameter 'vmware_cluster_name', the driver init
will fail with AttributeError.

This patch also adds a unit test which would have caught
this error during gate check.

Change-Id: I310456f5d677c6e100a91efc6228c533cb5bf208
Closes-Bug: #1488916

to make it sync with global requirements.

commit_message:
ML2: Move repeated calls to set constants out of delete_port to init

There is no reason to make these 2 calls inside of delete_port each time.
This occurs a lot thus I've moved them to be set once at __init__.

commit_message:
JSCS Cleanup - rename launch instance factory files

Per the JP style guide, renames factory and its spec to use the
.service.js convention. Future change will refactor the factory to use
the getter syntax as well as DI.

Change-Id: Iacd56999e35247ea2d95dc6dd8337a5ea4e8016e
Partially-Implements: blueprint jscs-cleanup

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-15 13:06:01.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/glusterfs/test_layout_volume.py', 'manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/layout_volume.py'], 'message': "glusterfs: Fix use of ShareSnapshotInstance object

Previously, a 'ShareSnapshot' object was passed to the driver's API
method by share's manager.py during a create_share_from_snapshot call.
Now, a 'ShareSnapshotInstance' object is passed to the driver during
the same call. The object no longer has the attribute 'share' used by
the driver code, and in it's place has the attribute 'share_instance'.
So replace use of 'share' attribute with 'share_instance'.

Change-Id: Ibea11b33772f24609f9cd3180d61ab7f6307c1b8
Closes-Bug: #1495382
"}]
commit_message:
glusterfs: Fix use of ShareSnapshotInstance object

Previously, a 'ShareSnapshot' object was passed to the driver's API
method by share's manager.py during a create_share_from_snapshot call.
Now, a 'ShareSnapshotInstance' object is passed to the driver during
the same call. The object no longer has the attribute 'share' used by
the driver code, and in it's place has the attribute 'share_instance'.
So replace use of 'share' attribute with 'share_instance'.

Change-Id: Ibea11b33772f24609f9cd3180d61ab7f6307c1b8
Closes-Bug: #1495382

commit_message:
Fix noops tests for the new network variables

* Refactor old noop tests to support flexible network data
* Repair puppet function helper
* Script to remove old external modules before updating them
* network_config_prepared function to check if network
  scheme is already loaded

Change-Id: Ie2e7e2a8a7fbfa32a4172e018acba6e955973425
Closes-Bug: 1486048
Fuel-CI: disable

RDO, RHOS in the binary installs for flags passed to build.py -t.

commit_message:
Refresh can_access cached values on *_policy.json change

In order for Dashboards & Panels visibility changes to take effect
immediately after Horizon restart (without the need for the User to
re-login), refresh cached Dashboards & Panels `can_access()` status
when any of `settings.POLICY_FILES` inside
`settings.POLICY_FILES_PATH` has been modified.

Change-Id: Icafbcedca5d0cdc1deee61a820079d0977ab8b2d
Closes-Bug: #1379358

This bug, inherited from Cinder, allows a tenant to view share
extra specs using the extra-specs-list CLI command.  The Cinder
fix was to check the admin context in the DB layer and filter out
all extra specs for non-admins.  This approach doesn't work for
Manila, because some extra specs are required and are effectively
part of the Manila API (DHSS, snapshot_support).  So in Manila we
define a set of tenant-visible extra specs and restrict the extra
spec values to that set in the share type view builder. Also, we
add policies for the share type list APIs so that admins can
control access to those if desired.

for non-admin users; the CLI was listing the extra specs returned
by the share type API, which is now filtered as described.

Closes-Bug: #1475285

commit_message:
Non-admin user can perform 'extra-specs-list'

This bug, inherited from Cinder, allows a tenant to view share
extra specs using the extra-specs-list CLI command.  The Cinder
fix was to check the admin context in the DB layer and filter out
all extra specs for non-admins.  This approach doesn't work for
Manila, because some extra specs are required and are effectively
part of the Manila API (DHSS, snapshot_support).  So in Manila we
define a set of tenant-visible extra specs and restrict the extra
spec values to that set in the share type view builder. Also, we
add policies for the share type list APIs so that admins can
control access to those if desired.

The separate API to list extra specs already has adequate checking
for non-admin users; the CLI was listing the extra specs returned
by the share type API, which is now filtered as described.

Co-Authored-By: Andrew Kerr <andrew.kerr@netapp.com>
Change-Id: I9b0a8ddc064c246286f26760b703db6e3e1bcd46
Closes-Bug: #1475285

commit_message:
Add 'snapshot_support' attr to share details

Recently was introduced feature where snapshots become optional.

Share started have new attr "snapshot_support". But it is absent in
share payload and, hence, can not be used outside of Manila.

Also, fix lost import of translation function for related snapshot API.

Change-Id: Iddb0cf1e046b9d480a22e79b33c8674a2405362e
Closes-Bug: #1491345
Closes-Bug: #1491346

commit_message:
Remove IBM GPFS driver due to lack of CI

The Manila community set a deadline of 3 Sep 2015 for all drivers
to have reporting CI systems, and there is no CI system for the
IBM GPFS driver. As agreed, the driver will be removed until such
time that a CI system exists.

Change-Id: I76f238a1a6eb039e4ddc1cb189115ab3e686c56b

commit_message:
Fix improper handling of extending error

If we try to extend share created with generic driver and Cinder does not have
enough free space to extend its volume then we get error "Insufficient
free space". But Manila updates share status only after 3 minutes.

Add check if volume status contains 'error' to  '_wait_for_available_volume'
function.

Closes-bug: #1484857

Change-Id: I1e206ec1c410c015a71f49e25ffa8e64b5870e64

subject: Force install grub packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-28 01:07:35.000000000', 'files': ['elements/redhat-common/pre-install.d/15-remove-grub'], 'message': 'Force install grub packages

The centos 7 base image may already have grub installed on it. In that
case, the vm element will fail and exit with:

 + source /tmp/grub/install
 ++ rpm -i /tmp/grub/grub2-2.02-0.16.el7.centos.x86_64.rpm
         package grub2-1:2.02-0.16.el7.centos.x86_64 is already installed

Add --replacepkgs to the `rpm -i` command to override the pre-installed
grub and avoid failing.

Change-Id: Ib857e71dae98630ca4e361c820fcbf9acab63728
'}]
commit_message:
Force install grub packages

The centos 7 base image may already have grub installed on it. In that
case, the vm element will fail and exit with:

 + source /tmp/grub/install
 ++ rpm -i /tmp/grub/grub2-2.02-0.16.el7.centos.x86_64.rpm
         package grub2-1:2.02-0.16.el7.centos.x86_64 is already installed

Add --replacepkgs to the `rpm -i` command to override the pre-installed
grub and avoid failing.

Change-Id: Ib857e71dae98630ca4e361c820fcbf9acab63728

subject: If 'bool_from_string' provided a boolean just return it
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-17 04:07:34.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/tests/test_strutils.py', 'oslo_utils/strutils.py'], 'message': 'If 'bool_from_string' provided a boolean just return it

Typically the pattern of the following happens:

>>> s = dict()
>>> v = s.get("blah", True)
>>> v = strutils.bool_from_string(v)

In this case we can avoid converting the value of 'v' to a bool
if it was already a boolean (and if it wasn't then the rest of
the code can be ran to attempt to convert it to one). This avoids
needlessly converting things from bool -> string -> bool which
is not really needed in this case.

Change-Id: Id7397e91e754ff2c63b3f112e95aedf82cd31717
'}]
commit_message:
If 'bool_from_string' provided a boolean just return it

Typically the pattern of the following happens:

>>> s = dict()
>>> v = s.get("blah", True)
>>> v = strutils.bool_from_string(v)

In this case we can avoid converting the value of 'v' to a bool
if it was already a boolean (and if it wasn't then the rest of
the code can be ran to attempt to convert it to one). This avoids
needlessly converting things from bool -> string -> bool which
is not really needed in this case.

Change-Id: Id7397e91e754ff2c63b3f112e95aedf82cd31717

Problem showed up with django_openstack_auth job that installs from
source. The change to devstack to verify LIBS_FROM_GIT kicked in
(Iffef2007f99a0e932b68c4c897ebbfb748cac2b4) and starting failing the
job. The problem was that the edit_constraint was not fixing the
django-openstack-auth line in upperconstraints.txt as the setup.cfg
had name = django_openstack_auth. Note that when things finally get
installed setup_tools' safe_name kicks in to standardize names and for
example glance_store will show up as glance-store in pip freeze. So we
should be able to treat this situation better and allow constraints to
have the safe names (using dashes).

Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
Change-Id: Ibaa22657a2cf2c0ad96dbd0b9bc43cdafe6a1d56
"}]
commit_message:
Deal with underscores in names in edit-constraints

Problem showed up with django_openstack_auth job that installs from
source. The change to devstack to verify LIBS_FROM_GIT kicked in
(Iffef2007f99a0e932b68c4c897ebbfb748cac2b4) and starting failing the
job. The problem was that the edit_constraint was not fixing the
django-openstack-auth line in upperconstraints.txt as the setup.cfg
had name = django_openstack_auth. Note that when things finally get
installed setup_tools' safe_name kicks in to standardize names and for
example glance_store will show up as glance-store in pip freeze. So we
should be able to treat this situation better and allow constraints to
have the safe names (using dashes).

Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
Change-Id: Ibaa22657a2cf2c0ad96dbd0b9bc43cdafe6a1d56

commit_message:
image build: separate the envvars for dib

Put in a separate dictionary all the environment variables we need to
set, updating the current environment right before invoking
disk-image-create/ramdisk-image-create.

The result should be the same, but allowing to separately have the
changes to the environment for further processing.

Change-Id: I2867cd55231f84f83052d1342201dc9bcbe3dee6

commit_message:
Drop USE_IRONIC from tripleo-incubator

I think we agreed we could drop nova baremetal support
from tripleo-incubator once Nova removed it.

This patch drops the USE_IRONIC option entirely and simply
sets Ironic up to be the default baremetal provisioning service.

Change-Id: Ibef2713e54955abf3fd7661e607653c18be1f395

commit_message:
apply limit constraint on storage base interface

Currently we have implemented limit constraint on get_meters,
get_resources, get_samples and query_samples on most of major databases,
but haven't applied such change on storage interface of get_meters and
get_resources, this patch adds parameter limit to those two methods.

Change-Id: I10e43e082ec9fd87dcd491299a57c0116009220e
Closes-Bug: #1496677

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 20:20:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vmops.py'], 'message': "Xenapi: Don't access image_meta.id when booting from a volume

When a request is made to boot from a preexisting volume, rather than
asking Nova to create a volume from an image, there is no image id field
in the image_meta that's passed in to the virt driver.  This would be
fine except that there was an attempt to access image_meta.id in the
boot from volume case where it is not necessary.  This change moves that
access to a point where it is known that this is not an attempt to boot
from a volume and that field should be set.

Change-Id: I9dab14762f5d331ef2e36f617f7f66c3d771f32d
Closes-bug: 1496557
"}]
commit_message:
Xenapi: Don't access image_meta.id when booting from a volume

When a request is made to boot from a preexisting volume, rather than
asking Nova to create a volume from an image, there is no image id field
in the image_meta that's passed in to the virt driver.  This would be
fine except that there was an attempt to access image_meta.id in the
boot from volume case where it is not necessary.  This change moves that
access to a point where it is known that this is not an attempt to boot
from a volume and that field should be set.

Change-Id: I9dab14762f5d331ef2e36f617f7f66c3d771f32d
Closes-bug: 1496557

commit_message:
Fix wrong check when use image in local

When use bdm to boot with image in local,we should check
whether boot_index is valid firstly.

For example,when use novaclient,boot_index is a string ,
it can't compare with integer directly.

Change-Id: I8c0c3793e4453b9a5d6daac7404c281c163ac474
Closes-bug:#1459917
(cherry picked from commit 1ae7d453e59f483f7a90fcd60aa51870ca11af92)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-17 08:51:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_extension_info.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/virtual_interfaces.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/all_extensions/extensions-list-resp-v21-compatible.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/all_extensions/extensions-list-resp-v21_compatible.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/all_extensions/extensions-list-resp-v21_comp.json.tpl', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/extension_info.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_virtual_interfaces.py', 'doc/api_samples/all_extensions/extensions-list-resp-v21-compatible.json'], 'message': 'Add 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id' for v21 compatible mode

There is difference in VIF list response for v2 and v2.1.
'net_id' attribute is not present in v2.1 VIF list response and
it was added as new microversion - Ic8b26df8d7e69bd71d23dfbc983fa3449c16fa7d

For v21 compatible mode we should have that attribute in response
to make v21 comp mode behaves same as v2.

Also VIF Extension "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" was removed from v2.1 ext list
in - Ic99ac1179d02d907422911fe1369b64479fd5f33

As we need to add 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id' in VIF
API response to make that same as v2 one. So ext list should have
"OS-EXT-VIF-NET" extension also to avoid any confusion for user whether
this extension is present for v21 comp mode or not.

This commit adds 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id' attribute in VIF list
response for v21 compatible mode.
Also adds VIF extension in ext list for v21 comp mode.

Change-Id: I4df76fbf85fbb1e79528a1690692b12a65f07835
'}]
commit_message:
Add 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id' for v21 compatible mode

There is difference in VIF list response for v2 and v2.1.
'net_id' attribute is not present in v2.1 VIF list response and
it was added as new microversion - Ic8b26df8d7e69bd71d23dfbc983fa3449c16fa7d

For v21 compatible mode we should have that attribute in response
to make v21 comp mode behaves same as v2.

Also VIF Extension "OS-EXT-VIF-NET" was removed from v2.1 ext list
in - Ic99ac1179d02d907422911fe1369b64479fd5f33

As we need to add 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id' in VIF
API response to make that same as v2 one. So ext list should have
"OS-EXT-VIF-NET" extension also to avoid any confusion for user whether
this extension is present for v21 comp mode or not.

This commit adds 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id' attribute in VIF list
response for v21 compatible mode.
Also adds VIF extension in ext list for v21 comp mode.

NOTE-There is no change in v2.1 API.

Closes-Bug #1496664

Change-Id: I4df76fbf85fbb1e79528a1690692b12a65f07835

commit_message:
DIB includes the "in-tree" elements by default

The default provided for --elements-path includes
'/usr/share/diskimage-builder/elements'. However,
diskimage-builder will include this path by default. This
will cause any element with a svc-map to fail with
duplicate svc-map entries.

This patch removes '/usr/share/diskimage-builder/elements'
from the default for --elements-path.

Change-Id: I388b564cb05f8bdb4006ac29df4837738453109a
Closes-Bug: #1494349

commit_message:
Fix check_migration error

- The head revision of expand branch in HEADS was incorrect.
- The contents of HEADS file should be in alphabetical order.

Also enable check_migration in pep8 check.

Change-Id: I2aeb879bf85aeba7ca6801adc39d7982c0a44572
Closes-Bug: #1496239

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-26 09:06:56.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': "Update volume status AFTER terminate_connection is done

Current volume API terminate_connection() updates volume's status in
DB before volume driver finishes terminate_connection().  In cases
where volume driver needs some time complete terminate_connection(),
it means volume becomes 'available' before volume driver done cleaning
up.  This fix changes the order of 'unreserve_volume' (updating DB)
and driver's terminate_connection to make sure when volume is marked
'available' the client has done cleaning connection.

Note that terminate_connection volume RPC API is a synchronized call,
but volume manager/driver doesn't return any value to caller.  What's
more, when volume API extension calls volume terminate_connection API,
it doesn't expect return values, so this change removes unnecessary
return values from volume API.

Closes-bug: #1488857

Change-Id: If79f7ce9a7d238b41be4c6befa0f3cac30ab06a3
"}]
commit_message:
Update volume status AFTER terminate_connection is done

Current volume API terminate_connection() updates volume's status in
DB before volume driver finishes terminate_connection().  In cases
where volume driver needs some time complete terminate_connection(),
it means volume becomes 'available' before volume driver done cleaning
up.  This fix changes the order of 'unreserve_volume' (updating DB)
and driver's terminate_connection to make sure when volume is marked
'available' the client has done cleaning connection.

Note that terminate_connection volume RPC API is a synchronized call,
but volume manager/driver doesn't return any value to caller.  What's
more, when volume API extension calls volume terminate_connection API,
it doesn't expect return values, so this change removes unnecessary
return values from volume API.

Closes-bug: #1488857

Change-Id: If79f7ce9a7d238b41be4c6befa0f3cac30ab06a3

commit_message:
inspection: prepare for future deprecations

1. cleanly separate deprecated and non-deprecated properties
2. add root disk to inspection data, so that we can have a proper
   fallback when root device hints are not given.

Change-Id: Ie19b82ff2a914873ff4b2395b02643e086b934b1

subject: odl client: gracefully ignore 404 when deleting
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-09-01 15:14:39.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/common/client.py', 'networking_odl/tests/unit/ml2/test_mechanism_odl.py', 'networking_odl/ml2/mech_driver.py'], 'message': "odl client: gracefully ignore 404 when deleting

When neutron and odl are out of sync, it's possible for neutron to
send delete request to ODL on the resource which ODL doesn't know.
In this case not found error code, 404, can be ignored gracefully
instead of returning an error to user.
This patch depends on ODL neutron northbound fix so that
it can return 404 instead of internal server error.

Change-Id: I2c7e699c227f1fa3251861a2698410666f767701
Closes-Bug: #1489593
"}]
commit_message:
odl client: gracefully ignore 404 when deleting

When neutron and odl are out of sync, it's possible for neutron to
send delete request to ODL on the resource which ODL doesn't know.
In this case not found error code, 404, can be ignored gracefully
instead of returning an error to user.
This patch depends on ODL neutron northbound fix so that
it can return 404 instead of internal server error.

Change-Id: I2c7e699c227f1fa3251861a2698410666f767701
Closes-Bug: #1489593

commit_message:
Compute v2.1 docs clean up (part12) (os-attach-interfaces)

   Add os-attach-interfaces
      WADL file is based on v2 ext (os-interface)
      JSON files are not linked one (i.e no move operation)

   Fix response code 202 => 200
      POST /v2.1/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/os-attach-interfaces
      GET /v2.1/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/os-attach-interfaces/{attachment_id}

Change-Id: I780fb378a8cc12a06ccaf62ddafd98f968d59195
Partial-Bug: #1488144

subject: Disable SElinux on CentOS7 jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 12:35:15.000000000', 'files': ['install_modules.sh'], 'message': 'Disable SElinux on CentOS7 jobs

python-cffi is preventing Nova & Keystone to run when SElinux is
enforced.
The bug is reported [1] and RDO team is working on it.
In the meantime, we need to disable SElinux so we can run our CI again.

This patch might be reverted once a fix is released in packaging.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1249685

Change-Id: I4720ec701cb36f56a9556a124204db32fa8e8434
'}]
commit_message:
Disable SElinux on CentOS7 jobs

python-cffi is preventing Nova & Keystone to run when SElinux is
enforced.
The bug is reported [1] and RDO team is working on it.
In the meantime, we need to disable SElinux so we can run our CI again.

This patch might be reverted once a fix is released in packaging.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1249685

Change-Id: I4720ec701cb36f56a9556a124204db32fa8e8434

commit_message:
Add test for requirements

It should help to indicate issues with python requirements faster.
Otherwise, we could end up with failed job to build ISO a bit later
which, in turn, will block the majority of other devs.

Change-Id: I04e9de0dd5b794ab89d912c661d47d691a8fcb1d
Related-Bug: #1481297

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-10 19:39:40.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/builddoc.py'], 'message': "Support Sphinx >=1.3 new protoype and warnings

Sphinx >= 1.3 changes:
- Prototypes for init_values() requires a handle to warnings.warn
- New warning for setting the html_theme in conf.py to 'default':
   sphinx.errors.SphinxWarning: WARNING: 'default' html theme has been
   renamed to 'classic'. Please change your html_theme setting either
   to the new 'alabaster' default theme, or to 'classic' to keep using
   the old default.

This change deals with the above sphinx updates by adding the handle to
init_values() and setting pbr to _not_ fail on warnings when building the
docs.

Change-Id: Iba92628263e20efca84aeada0e19000f4c9b1fac
"}]
commit_message:
Support Sphinx >=1.3 new protoype and warnings

Sphinx >= 1.3 changes:
- Prototypes for init_values() requires a handle to warnings.warn
- New warning for setting the html_theme in conf.py to 'default':
   sphinx.errors.SphinxWarning: WARNING: 'default' html theme has been
   renamed to 'classic'. Please change your html_theme setting either
   to the new 'alabaster' default theme, or to 'classic' to keep using
   the old default.

This change deals with the above sphinx updates by adding the handle to
init_values() and setting pbr to _not_ fail on warnings when building the
docs.

Change-Id: Iba92628263e20efca84aeada0e19000f4c9b1fac

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-17 12:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['os_windows/_hacking/__init__.py', 'os_windows/_i18n.py', 'os_windows/utils/networkutils.py', 'os_windows/tests/test_utilsfactory.py', 'os_windows/utils/basevolumeutils.py', 'os_windows/_hacking/checks.py', 'os_windows/tests/utils/test_pathutils.py', 'requirements.txt', 'os_windows/utils/vmutilsv2.py', 'os_windows/tests/utils/test_jobutils.py', 'os_windows/utils/vmutils.py', 'os_windows/utils/livemigrationutils.py', 'os_windows/utils/networkutilsv2.py', 'tox.ini', 'os_windows/utils/pathutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes project for Jenkins runs

Fixes the project for Jenkins runs by adding hacking and hacking
rules, fixing pep8 issues, adding eventlet dependency.

Fixes test_jobutils, mocks wmi module.

Includes bugfix:

Hyper-V: Fix missing WMI namespace issue on Windows 2008 R2

The Hyper-V driver uses the Microsoft\Windows\SMB WMI namespace
in order to handle SMB shares. The issue is that this namespace is
not available on Windows versions prior to Windows Server 2012.

For this reason, the Hyper-V driver fails to initialize on Windows
Server 2008 R2.

This patch fixes the issue by properly handling the PathUtils
initialization.

Closes-Bug: #1463044
Change-Id: Ia99576589af6049ee07337c631ed7d5d6cf602d9

Change-Id: Ide670f759822b2af8fe92a3a1ea0542618f13370
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes project for Jenkins runs

Fixes the project for Jenkins runs by adding hacking and hacking
rules, fixing pep8 issues, adding eventlet dependency.

Fixes test_jobutils, mocks wmi module.

Includes bugfix:

Hyper-V: Fix missing WMI namespace issue on Windows 2008 R2

The Hyper-V driver uses the Microsoft\Windows\SMB WMI namespace
in order to handle SMB shares. The issue is that this namespace is
not available on Windows versions prior to Windows Server 2012.

For this reason, the Hyper-V driver fails to initialize on Windows
Server 2008 R2.

This patch fixes the issue by properly handling the PathUtils
initialization.

Closes-Bug: #1463044
Change-Id: Ia99576589af6049ee07337c631ed7d5d6cf602d9

Change-Id: Ide670f759822b2af8fe92a3a1ea0542618f13370

subject: Expose min and max to IntOpt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-14 19:01:18.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_generator.py', 'tests/test_generator.py', 'oslo_config/tests/test_cfg.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py', 'oslo_config/generator.py', 'tests/test_cfg.py'], 'message': 'Expose min and max to IntOpt

The IntOpt class utilizes the types.Integer class which has
parameters for setting the minimum and maximum value.  These min
and max values are not exposed through IntOpt and should be ideally.

In the docstring help for cfg.py, it gives an example of creating a
PortType instance of types.Integer to create a new type with a range.
Rather than projects having to define this new instance, seems better
to just expose the min and max to IntOpt.

Another advantage of adding min and max to IntOpt is the ability to
generate a useful sample config file that displays the range of
valid integer values.

Change-Id: Icce7b6799061711ea512d60facc57bf7d6f6c9cc
(cherry picked from commit 366ca45ef2f46b4a3eb50b283b9b745242aa4bf9)
'}]
commit_message:
Expose min and max to IntOpt

The IntOpt class utilizes the types.Integer class which has
parameters for setting the minimum and maximum value.  These min
and max values are not exposed through IntOpt and should be ideally.

In the docstring help for cfg.py, it gives an example of creating a
PortType instance of types.Integer to create a new type with a range.
Rather than projects having to define this new instance, seems better
to just expose the min and max to IntOpt.

Another advantage of adding min and max to IntOpt is the ability to
generate a useful sample config file that displays the range of
valid integer values.

Change-Id: Icce7b6799061711ea512d60facc57bf7d6f6c9cc
(cherry picked from commit 366ca45ef2f46b4a3eb50b283b9b745242aa4bf9)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-16 11:23:46.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Don't run python jobs for old Fuel Client

Support for python jobs was only added in the current version
which is 7.0. Therefore it's necessary to not block any patch
for any of 6.1.* versions that does not pass python tests on
OpenStack CI. Since Python-3 support is currently being
implemented, it's necessary to not run that job on 7.0 stable
branch.

Change-Id: I547145cd42001f349cefeac284d6b9e83b15bae1
Closes-bug: #1495890
"}]
commit_message:
Don't run python jobs for old Fuel Client

Support for python jobs was only added in the current version
which is 7.0. Therefore it's necessary to not block any patch
for any of 6.1.* versions that does not pass python tests on
OpenStack CI. Since Python-3 support is currently being
implemented, it's necessary to not run that job on 7.0 stable
branch.

Change-Id: I547145cd42001f349cefeac284d6b9e83b15bae1
Closes-bug: #1495890

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 16:36:41.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Add possibility to skip test_subnet_details if DHCP client not available

The help message of the dhcp_client option from the scenario section says
"...If left empty, update operation will be skipped. ...", but allowed
choises are only "udhcpc" and "dhclient". So we don't have any way to skip
the test_subnet_details test if DHCP client is not available. This patch
fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I10c403f4da257e6b39b855ae8b4b9ac16a8e7fc4
Closes-Bug: #1493909
'}]
commit_message:
Add possibility to skip test_subnet_details if DHCP client not available

The help message of the dhcp_client option from the scenario section says
"...If left empty, update operation will be skipped. ...", but allowed
choises are only "udhcpc" and "dhclient". So we don't have any way to skip
the test_subnet_details test if DHCP client is not available. This patch
fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I10c403f4da257e6b39b855ae8b4b9ac16a8e7fc4
Closes-Bug: #1493909

This is a replacement for the approach outlined in

template, even if the stack is in a failed state, by making use

commit_message:
PATCH update reuse existing template

This is a replacement for the approach outlined in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/154620, we reuse the previous
template, even if the stack is in a failed state, by making use
of the prev_raw_template now stored at the start of each update.

Closes-Bug: 1224828
Change-Id: I0294745dea0d25b91dbcc50a8bd55b3e1ea87d81

commit_message:
Stop WP deployment if PHP is not installed

Wordpress will not work if user forgets to install apache with option
'install php'. This patch adds handling for this situation

Change-Id: I03a2b62fce832f18e1aa0be78a756832677b1c3d
Closes-Bug: #1493375

commit_message:
Containers with host networking fail to 'su' on some kernels

Some kernels don't allow 'su' inside of containers when
the latter run with --net=host option. The issue is mentioned
at https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/5899 and still is open
The workaround is to use 'sudo' instead - it works everywhere.

Change-Id: I237032f20819116ae0291ab63b3966f4ed89e517
Closes-Bug: #1480209

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-17 03:09:18.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "zuul/layout: puppet openstack updates

This patch aims to:

* stop grizzly & havana support (EOL[1]): we don't expect CI working
  in these branches anymore, so we want to drop zuul matching rules.
* update layout matching for unit-4.0: they should only be run for
  stable/kilo and later.
* update layout matching for syntax: they should only be run for
  stable/kilo and later.
* run unit-latest on master only and non-voting. It aims to test future
  version of Puppet (will be Puppet 5.x) and break one day. We don't
  want stable branches running the job, only master for now.
* enabling voting for openstack_extras: recent patches in the module
  made acceptance working, let's enabling voting.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/releases/

Change-Id: I96c184391d43b3475370d65090f932c9181100ef
"}]
commit_message:
zuul/layout: puppet openstack updates

This patch aims to:

* stop grizzly & havana support (EOL[1]): we don't expect CI working
  in these branches anymore, so we want to drop zuul matching rules.
* update layout matching for unit-4.0: they should only be run for
  stable/kilo and later.
* update layout matching for syntax: they should only be run for
  stable/kilo and later.
* run unit-latest on master only and non-voting. It aims to test future
  version of Puppet (will be Puppet 5.x) and break one day. We don't
  want stable branches running the job, only master for now.
* enabling voting for openstack_extras: recent patches in the module
  made acceptance working, let's enabling voting.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/releases/

Change-Id: I96c184391d43b3475370d65090f932c9181100ef

commit_message:
run_tests: stop pinning tempest repo

We had a workaround due to a new test in
tempest/api/identity/v3/test_projects.py* that used to fail.

This patch aims to drop the pin and come back to master.

* test_list_projects_returns_only_authorized_project

subject: Revert ordering of bridges in patch port action
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-17 10:51:16.000000000', 'files': ['octane/helpers/transformations.py'], 'message': "Revert ordering of bridges in patch port action

Now we select the first bridge from bridges in patch port action.
This doesn't work for a case when patch port is created on the side of physical
bridge due to network template specifics. It also doesn't support a case when
connected bridges have different providers.

Change-Id: I2f554936686a60838fd2a919d888a7e31a3693a9
"}]
commit_message:
Revert ordering of bridges in patch port action

Now we select the first bridge from bridges in patch port action.
This doesn't work for a case when patch port is created on the side of physical
bridge due to network template specifics. It also doesn't support a case when
connected bridges have different providers.

Change-Id: I2f554936686a60838fd2a919d888a7e31a3693a9

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-02 19:46:10.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/server-count-api.rst'], 'message': 'Nova Server Count API Parameter

Proposes a new v2.1 REST API query string parameter that returns
the number of servers that match the specified search criteria in
the body of the existing GET servers reply.

Note that a /servers/count API extension was approved for juno but
this spec is being changed to return the count information based on
the existence of an "with_count=1" parameter; this aligns with the
API working group guideline for counting resources.

bp server-count-api
APIImpact

Change-Id: I282d6c6b2bf263543a2e6f9298c8ddbd49df75eb
'}]
commit_message:
Nova Server Count API Parameter

Proposes a new v2.1 REST API query string parameter that returns
the number of servers that match the specified search criteria in
the body of the existing GET servers reply.

Note that a /servers/count API extension was approved for juno but
this spec is being changed to return the count information based on
the existence of an "with_count=1" parameter; this aligns with the
API working group guideline for counting resources.

bp server-count-api
APIImpact

Change-Id: I282d6c6b2bf263543a2e6f9298c8ddbd49df75eb

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-09-16 12:32:59.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/extraconfig/pre_deploy/controller/neutron-ml2-bigswitch.yaml', 'environments/neutron-ml2-bigswitch.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "Big Switch Neutron ML2 plugin integration

Add support for Big Switch Neutron ML2 plugin. Makes sure that the
package is present and sets up the [restproxy] section in ml2_conf.ini.

This also adds support for setting the ovs_use_veth option in
l3_agent.ini. There is no support for this in puppet-neutron l3 class
and it probably doesn't make sense adding it there, because this setting
isn't relevant for all l3 agent drivers, it's specific to

Change-Id: I99635e25b2099dacce68154fe14693d6f06ac19f
"}]
commit_message:
Big Switch Neutron ML2 plugin integration

Add support for Big Switch Neutron ML2 plugin. Makes sure that the
package is present and sets up the [restproxy] section in ml2_conf.ini.

This also adds support for setting the ovs_use_veth option in
l3_agent.ini. There is no support for this in puppet-neutron l3 class
and it probably doesn't make sense adding it there, because this setting
isn't relevant for all l3 agent drivers, it's specific to
OVSInterfaceDriver. The ovs_use_veth option is also added to
dhcp_agent.ini.

Change-Id: I99635e25b2099dacce68154fe14693d6f06ac19f

commit_message:
Fix task_state field shown on API < 2.5

After Share Migration was included, the task_state field was
added to be displayed on GET requests, but API versions prior to
2.5 should not see this field. This patch fixes that by using
microversions.

Closes-bug: #1494746
Change-Id: Ie755ae53fe8efdf1702a0ecbabf022a5fe4beb93

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-24 20:37:48.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'validation-scripts/all-nodes.sh', 'all-nodes-validation.yaml'], 'message': 'network validation to ping test each interface

This patches wires in a new "all nodes" validation resource
that can be used to add validations that occur early on
during the deployment process. This occurs after the nodes
have been brought online and the initial networks
have been configured but before any "post" (puppet, etc.)
sort of configuration has been executed.

A initial validation script has been added to ping test network IPs
on each network. When using network isolation this will ensure
network connectivity (vlans, etc) are working on each
node and if not the heat stack will fail early, allowing
time to fix the network connections and retry the
stack creation via an update.

Change-Id: I63cf95b27e8ad2aed48718cf84df5f324780e597
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>

commit_message:
network validation to ping test each interface

This patches wires in a new "all nodes" validation resource
that can be used to add validations that occur early on
during the deployment process. This occurs after the nodes
have been brought online and the initial networks
have been configured but before any "post" (puppet, etc.)
sort of configuration has been executed.

A initial validation script has been added to ping test network IPs
on each network. When using network isolation this will ensure
network connectivity (vlans, etc) are working on each
node and if not the heat stack will fail early, allowing
time to fix the network connections and retry the
stack creation via an update.

Change-Id: I63cf95b27e8ad2aed48718cf84df5f324780e597
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add YAML sanity check

Adds a "validate" tox env for basic sanity checking of templates.
Currently it just validates that all of the .yaml files are in fact
valid YAML.  In the future we might want to add more, but this
seemed like a reasonable start.

Change-Id: I8091bbad0003b150e23dae5de4f465053c982229

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-16 18:07:30.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py', 'doc/source/template_guide/hot_spec.rst', 'heat/engine/hot/template.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': 'Allow map/list items for str_replace

Currently any attempt to substitute placeholders using data from a
json/map or list parameter/attribute results in an error, which is
inconvenient if you wish to provide such data to an instance, e.g
so it can be used in a script via jq/python or whatever.

So, tolerate non-string parameter values, and attempt to serialize
them as json, then substitute the resulting json strings.

Change-Id: I362cc76ac3f68d4649a62459455c0dcae2dcd25d
Closes-Bug: #1489028
'}]
commit_message:
Allow map/list items for str_replace

Currently any attempt to substitute placeholders using data from a
json/map or list parameter/attribute results in an error, which is
inconvenient if you wish to provide such data to an instance, e.g
so it can be used in a script via jq/python or whatever.

So, tolerate non-string parameter values, and attempt to serialize
them as json, then substitute the resulting json strings.

Change-Id: I362cc76ac3f68d4649a62459455c0dcae2dcd25d
Closes-Bug: #1489028

commit_message:
Reject rule if assertion type unset

When the "type" of the remote rule is not present in the assertion this
should constitute a failure to match and reject the local change.

Change-Id: Idba9a95f31a28401b2d49545347175ee0f324ab5
Closes-Bug: #1487937

commit_message:
Improving find  static robustness

The find static utility method assumes a filesystem layout
that may or may not be present on certain distros.  This fixes
this by using the python install path.

Closes-bug: #1494171

Change-Id: Iab72b4b872849d2496cc634677e5bfe478aa03be

subject: Update our handling of pbr.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 22:23:12.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'openstack_requirements/cmds/update.py'], 'message': "Update our handling of pbr.

*) We're removing our upper caps - they are just time bombs. Make pbr
   be consistent here too.

*) pbr 1.8 handles comments in marker lines properly. We don't need to
   update the run-time minimum, but we do need a build-time minimum of
   1.8 to ensure OpenStack packages can build properly.

Change-Id: I9fe0c62e774c00c2e521e1e69c5f2f5d87865ec1
"}]
commit_message:
Update our handling of pbr.

*) We're removing our upper caps - they are just time bombs. Make pbr
   be consistent here too.

*) pbr 1.8 handles comments in marker lines properly. We don't need to
   update the run-time minimum, but we do need a build-time minimum of
   1.8 to ensure OpenStack packages can build properly.

Change-Id: I9fe0c62e774c00c2e521e1e69c5f2f5d87865ec1

commit_message:
Move add/remove fixed ip action to servers_client

Add/remove fixed ips are server action and currently in
interface_client. As all other servers actions are in servers_client
so these two methods also should be in servers_client instead of
interface_client.

This commit moves add/remove fixed ips methods to servers_client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Idacc612bfed3d5a4abd58c8a987f68675b948f86

subject: Fix spec: Inject NMI to an instance
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-07 00:42:37.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/inject-nmi.rst'], 'message': "Fix spec: Inject NMI to an instance

This patch fixes the spec for adding an API to inject an NMI. Based on
comments of source review, the patch fixes these points.

- Misdescription of HTTP method
  Server actions use POST method. PUT is wrong.
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/202617/7/nova/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst

- The description of response code 400 is changed.
  The case where a validation error occurs is added.
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/202617/5/nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py

  NotImplementedError is not returned because the API is asynchronous.
  When RPC version doesn't allow the API, an error is returned.

- Add server states accepting the API
  Other states accept an NMI.
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/202605/4/nova/compute/api.py

Change-Id: I5029331750d54796251f78d77c727f283945f49c
Implements: blueprint inject-nmi
"}]
commit_message:
Fix spec: Inject NMI to an instance

This patch fixes the spec for adding an API to inject an NMI. Based on
comments of source review, the patch fixes these points.

- Misdescription of HTTP method
  Server actions use POST method. PUT is wrong.
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/202617/7/nova/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst

- The description of response code 400 is changed.
  The case where a validation error occurs is added.
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/202617/5/nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py

  NotImplementedError is not returned because the API is asynchronous.
  When RPC version doesn't allow the API, an error is returned.

- Add server states accepting the API
  Other states accept an NMI.
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/202605/4/nova/compute/api.py

Change-Id: I5029331750d54796251f78d77c727f283945f49c
Implements: blueprint inject-nmi

commit_message:
Remove ansible_ssh_user from Kolla configs

The option is not for Kolla to be managing, this is all on the
operator to handle the ssh communication to the other hosts.

Additionally, setting it like this will break delegate_to

Change-Id: Ib9caa7014049f87f3ece525a32f7587e33840ea9
Closes-Bug: #1496331

ramdisk.

HDS HNAS driver fails when tracking HNAS tree-clone-job status,
thus it incorrectly triggers snapshot creation timeout. This occurs
because the JobStatus class cannot successfully parse the HNAS
tree-clone-job status command output. This patch fixes these class
issues.

Closes-Bug: #1495564
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HDS HNAS snapshot creation tracking

HDS HNAS driver fails when tracking HNAS tree-clone-job status,
thus it incorrectly triggers snapshot creation timeout. This occurs
because the JobStatus class cannot successfully parse the HNAS
tree-clone-job status command output. This patch fixes these class
issues.

Change-Id: I9e5f45c48966381afba06204b9106eb11d33398c
Closes-Bug: #1495564

subject: Revert "Updated from global requirements"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 07:53:22.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', '.gitreview', 'test-requirements.txt', 'setup.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Updated from global requirements"

While there is nothing wrong with the g-r sync tagging it as 1.4.1 caused kilo
to break.  The then broke the kilo grenade tests.
    
As a quick fix:
 - Revert the g-r sync
 - tag that as 1.4.2
    
1.4.2 *needs* to be a descendant of 1.4.1 so just re-releaseing 1.4.0 again
doesn't work :(
    
Partial-Bug: 1496678
This reverts commit 7eeccd87699acd11b93058bd4e4cbeb801c70986.

Change-Id: I358831cabeee3d29d69563f9b3393b36287bd535
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Updated from global requirements"

While there is nothing wrong with the g-r sync tagging it as 1.4.1 caused kilo
to break.  The then broke the kilo grenade tests.
    
As a quick fix:
 - Revert the g-r sync
 - tag that as 1.4.2
    
1.4.2 *needs* to be a descendant of 1.4.1 so just re-releaseing 1.4.0 again
doesn't work :(
    
Partial-Bug: 1496678
This reverts commit 7eeccd87699acd11b93058bd4e4cbeb801c70986.

commit_message:
Introduce sahara::db class

Current modules [1,2,3] implements a <component>::db class that
is not implemented in Sahara. This commit aims to apply here the same logic.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-designate/blob/master/manifests/db.pp
[3] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ceilometer/blob/master/manifests/db.pp

Change-Id: Ie8eab88e2a785ae31acb16def04c7021ed604bc6

commit_message:
Add retries to repo connectivity checker

Sometimes under heavy load, infra may return 5xx errors. It's ok, and
most package installer are able to handle it properly. So let's
introduce retries to check connectivity, so our system tests will stop
fail time-to-time.

Related-Bug: #1493390

Change-Id: I96c2c2b6e94428085d47c2d40e0ae3753304a8f6
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

subject: Don't use serial console to avoid kernel lockups
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8596, 'name': 'Igor Marnat', 'email': 'igor.marnat@gmail.com', 'username': 'imarnat'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8882, 'name': 'Nastya Urlapova', 'email': 'aurlapova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'NastyaUrlapova'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 12200, 'name': 'Sebastian Kalinowski', 'email': 'sebastian@kalinowski.eu', 'username': 'prmtl'}, {'_account_id': 13609, 'name': 'Pavel Boldin', 'email': 'pboldin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pboldin'}, {'_account_id': 14864, 'name': 'Dmitry Klenov', 'email': 'dklenov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dklenov'}, {'_account_id': 15243, 'name': 'Andrey Maksimov', 'email': 'andrey@maksimov.space', 'username': 'amaksimov'}, {'_account_id': 15692, 'name': 'Dmitry Kalashnik', 'email': 'dkalashnik@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dkalashnik'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 16:21:37.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/openstack.yaml', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Don't use serial console to avoid kernel lockups

In general OpenStack services are quite chatty and produce a lot
of logs. A serial console (an actual hardware rather than a qemu
driven pty) might be unable to handle them and lock up the whole
system.

1. The kernel is instructed to use the serial console by the command
   line arguments: console=ttyS0,9600 console=tty0
2. qemu-nbd (or kernel nbd client?) misfunctions and causes a log
   storm: about 2200 messages get emitted during 50 milliseconds.
3. Transferring those 2200+ lines each 60 bytes long with the speed
   of 9600 bits per second will take about 2 minutes. This locks
   the CPU #0 (which has been running an nbd related ioctl on behalf
   of qemu-nbd) in the kernel mode for that period of time.
4. Meanwhile (the only) qemu-system-x86 starts up, opens /dev/kvm and
   sends an ioctl to create a VM. The control reaches
   virt/kvm/kvm_main.c:hardware_enable_all(), which invokes
   on_each_cpu(hardware_enable_nolock, NULL, 1);
   CPU #8 (where qemu-system-x86 runs) waits on a splinlock for
   the call to finish.
5. It looks like the serial console hardware (or driver?) locks up so
   printk never finishes and causes CPU #0 to block in the kernel mode
   forever. As a result an IPI which should have been invoked
   hardware_enable_nolock on CPU #0 never gets delivered, which makes
   CPU #8 (running qemu-system-x86) spin forever. The system has been
   locked up.

Don't use the serial console by default to avoid such (soft) lockups.

Closes-Bug: #1493767

Change-Id: I5c7798323d40d61e5252c3e71390066197386154
(cherry picked from commit d671c33460db62fe0dd65b6ea46358e2fa4a39fa)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use serial console to avoid kernel lockups

In general OpenStack services are quite chatty and produce a lot
of logs. A serial console (an actual hardware rather than a qemu
driven pty) might be unable to handle them and lock up the whole
system.

1. The kernel is instructed to use the serial console by the command
   line arguments: console=ttyS0,9600 console=tty0
2. qemu-nbd (or kernel nbd client?) misfunctions and causes a log
   storm: about 2200 messages get emitted during 50 milliseconds.
3. Transferring those 2200+ lines each 60 bytes long with the speed
   of 9600 bits per second will take about 2 minutes. This locks
   the CPU #0 (which has been running an nbd related ioctl on behalf
   of qemu-nbd) in the kernel mode for that period of time.
4. Meanwhile (the only) qemu-system-x86 starts up, opens /dev/kvm and
   sends an ioctl to create a VM. The control reaches
   virt/kvm/kvm_main.c:hardware_enable_all(), which invokes
   on_each_cpu(hardware_enable_nolock, NULL, 1);
   CPU #8 (where qemu-system-x86 runs) waits on a splinlock for
   the call to finish.
5. It looks like the serial console hardware (or driver?) locks up so
   printk never finishes and causes CPU #0 to block in the kernel mode
   forever. As a result an IPI which should have been invoked
   hardware_enable_nolock on CPU #0 never gets delivered, which makes
   CPU #8 (running qemu-system-x86) spin forever. The system has been
   locked up.

Don't use the serial console by default to avoid such (soft) lockups.

Closes-Bug: #1493767

Change-Id: I5c7798323d40d61e5252c3e71390066197386154
(cherry picked from commit d671c33460db62fe0dd65b6ea46358e2fa4a39fa)

subject: py3: Fix tox -e py34
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6623, 'name': 'Roman Prykhodchenko', 'email': 'me@romcheg.me', 'username': 'prykhodchenko'}, {'_account_id': 8122, 'name': 'Cyril Roelandt', 'email': 'cyril@redhat.com', 'username': 'cyril.roelandt.enovance'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 12200, 'name': 'Sebastian Kalinowski', 'email': 'sebastian@kalinowski.eu', 'username': 'prmtl'}, {'_account_id': 14543, 'name': 'Maciej Kwiek', 'email': 'mkwiek@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mkwiek'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-09-15 10:02:00.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'py3: Fix tox -e py34

Run a subset of tests on Python 3.4: only run test_utils currently.
With a working "tox -e py34", the py34 check job can be made voting.
A voting check job ensures that no code incompatible with Python 3
will be added back to the code tested by "tox -e py34". It avoids the
risk of having to port the same code twice to Python 3.

When more tests are ported to Python 3.4, the whitelist of tests
will grow slowly. The goal is to remove the [testenv:py34] section
from tox.ini to run all tests on Python 3.4.

Change-Id: I164d2ff3d948c8339edcfd96abc46d869018a324
'}]
commit_message:
py3: Fix tox -e py34

Run a subset of tests on Python 3.4: only run test_utils currently.
With a working "tox -e py34", the py34 check job can be made voting.
A voting check job ensures that no code incompatible with Python 3
will be added back to the code tested by "tox -e py34". It avoids the
risk of having to port the same code twice to Python 3.

When more tests are ported to Python 3.4, the whitelist of tests
will grow slowly. The goal is to remove the [testenv:py34] section
from tox.ini to run all tests on Python 3.4.

Change-Id: I164d2ff3d948c8339edcfd96abc46d869018a324

subject: Show 'Tenant name' column for non-admin users
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 16:50:06.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/packages/tables.py', 'muranodashboard/packages/views.py'], 'message': "Show 'Tenant name' column for non-admin users

To identify own packages and foreign (public) packages,
column with tenant teme is provided.
It is shown for admin, and now enabled for non-admin.

Since non-admin have no rights to identify tenant by id,
'other' is used instead for non-user tenant.

Related-Bug: 1496418

commit_message:
Show 'Tenant name' column for non-admin users

To identify own packages and foreign (public) packages,
column with tenant teme is provided.
It is shown for admin, and now enabled for non-admin.

Since non-admin have no rights to identify tenant by id,
'other' is used instead for non-user tenant.

Change-Id: I482b89d6659297d8dd3dc5c7882408278b471220
Related-Bug: 1496418

commit_message:
Port test_utils to Python 3

* Encode explicitly JSON to UTF-8 to get HTTP body as bytes
  on Python 3.
* Use a literal byte string, instead of a native string, for the HTTP
  body.

Change-Id: I1ee88e1abcded9dfaf3f1d9f720782b0d7ad662d

commit_message:
Unsubscribe target listener when leaving

We are using Redis-based persistent name storage, so
unrelated references should be cleaned when listener
doesn't exist any more.

Change-Id: I464a17d6de1d1679244db51f54f620017da071b3

commit_message:
py3: replace itertools.imap with six.moves.map

* Replace itertools.ifilter with six.moves.filter
* Replace itertools.imap with six.moves.map

This patch was generated by the sixer tool using the operation
"itertools".

Change-Id: Ie48cd0acd3c734d2bbca950eb12c2e1f01a48322

py3: Get urllib modules from six

Replace urllib2 import with six.moves.urllib to support Python 2 and
Python 3 in a single code base.

This patch by generated by the sixer tool using the operation
"urllib".

commit_message:
Fix a few leaks in the AMQP 1.0 driver.

Break any references that can form a cyclic reference.  Several of
proton's python classes define __del__ methods, so a cyclic reference
must be broken manually.

Change-Id: Icabc7abd01a02cb80c7eb4a0de682e90308459ef
Closes-Bug: #1496540

subject: Add --service-client option to migration script
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-16 22:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['tools/migrate_from_tempest.sh'], 'message': 'Add --service-client option to migration script

We are migrating service clients to tempeset-lib, but we needed to
update many places by hands even if using the migration script.
There is a pattern of update, so this patch adds a new option
--service-client for updating them automatically.
We can use it like:

 $ tools/migrate_from_tempest.sh -u ../tempest -s \
   tempest/services/compute/json/availability_zone_client.py \
   tempest/tests/services/compute/test_availability_zone_client.py \
   tempest/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/availability_zone.py

Partially implements blueprint migrate-service-clients-to-tempest-lib

Change-Id: Iab832501725cedd5c5fcc65d760ce8a9794223ac
'}]
commit_message:
Add --service-client option to migration script

We are migrating service clients to tempeset-lib, but we needed to
update many places by hands even if using the migration script.
There is a pattern of update, so this patch adds a new option
--service-client for updating them automatically.
We can use it like:

 $ tools/migrate_from_tempest.sh -u ../tempest -s \
   tempest/services/compute/json/availability_zone_client.py \
   tempest/tests/services/compute/test_availability_zone_client.py \
   tempest/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/availability_zone.py

Partially implements blueprint migrate-service-clients-to-tempest-lib

Change-Id: Iab832501725cedd5c5fcc65d760ce8a9794223ac

commit_message:
Base IronicObject on VersionedObject

Make IronicObject based on VersionedObject and introduce
VersionedObjectDictCompat class from oslo library. This is only a
temporary solution to support object['key']. Object should only be
called like object.key

Make all objects multiple inherit from these two classes can reduce the
future work to remove the support of IronicObjectDictCompat. This will be
addressed in next patches once finish the migration to oslo.versionedobject
library.

Partial-Bug: #1461239
Change-Id: Ieb2c406c10da75f9c42320085c563c166eda1703

Few hours ago the new version of oslo.utils (1.4.1) has been released [1].
It has incompatible requirements for oslo.i18n, so we have to pin it
temporary until we up oslo.i18n version.

[1]: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/?id=1.4.1

subject: Make Nailgun tests independed from PYTHONHASHSEED
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 11577, 'name': 'Ivan Kliuk', 'email': 'ivan.kliuk+spam@gmail.com', 'username': 'ivan'}, {'_account_id': 12200, 'name': 'Sebastian Kalinowski', 'email': 'sebastian@kalinowski.eu', 'username': 'prmtl'}, {'_account_id': 14543, 'name': 'Maciej Kwiek', 'email': 'mkwiek@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mkwiek'}, {'_account_id': 15454, 'name': 'Sylwester Brzeczkowski', 'email': 'sbrzeczkowski@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sbrzeczkowski'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-17 09:28:03.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_network_configuration_validator.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_network_manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_task.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer_70.py'], 'message': "Make Nailgun tests independed from PYTHONHASHSEED

test_vlan_range
  The test has been failing because JSON schema validates restriction in
  order that depends on PYTHOHASHSEED. So the fix is to use proper
  values with only one incorrect value.

test_non_default_bridge_mapping
  The test has been failing because we have a suffix generation for
  bridges implemented via counter. We generate a bridge name with a
  suffix iterating over networks, and PYTHONHASHSEED affects order of
  iteration. So the fix is to do not test bridge names strictly, but
  just most important limits.

test_update_networks_meta
  The test has been failing because dictionarie's .update() method do
  not perform recursive update, and removes some needed keys
  (such as 'name') so next network lookup may fail.

TestDeleteIBPImagesTask
  The test has been failing because CMD line has files to remove, and
  their order depend on PYTHONHASHSEED (since they are extracted as
  .keys() from some dictionary structure). So the fix is to perform
  smart check for the command line, not strict one.

Closes-Bug: #1496448

Change-Id: I882bbf53f48c842070cb336b1185c40a3dfacc6b
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>
"}]
commit_message:
Make Nailgun tests independed from PYTHONHASHSEED

test_vlan_range
  The test has been failing because JSON schema validates restriction in
  order that depends on PYTHOHASHSEED. So the fix is to use proper
  values with only one incorrect value.

test_non_default_bridge_mapping
  The test has been failing because we have a suffix generation for
  bridges implemented via counter. We generate a bridge name with a
  suffix iterating over networks, and PYTHONHASHSEED affects order of
  iteration. So the fix is to do not test bridge names strictly, but
  just most important limits.

test_update_networks_meta
  The test has been failing because dictionarie's .update() method do
  not perform recursive update, and removes some needed keys
  (such as 'name') so next network lookup may fail.

TestDeleteIBPImagesTask
  The test has been failing because CMD line has files to remove, and
  their order depend on PYTHONHASHSEED (since they are extracted as
  .keys() from some dictionary structure). So the fix is to perform
  smart check for the command line, not strict one.

Closes-Bug: #1496448

Change-Id: I882bbf53f48c842070cb336b1185c40a3dfacc6b
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-17 06:48:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/virtual_interfaces.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_virtual_interfaces.py'], 'message': "Add 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id' for v21 compatible mode

There is difference in VIF list response for v2 and v2.1.
'net_id' attribute is not present in v2.1 VIF list response and
it was added as new microversion - Ic8b26df8d7e69bd71d23dfbc983fa3449c16fa7d

For v21 compatible mode we should have that attribute in response
same as v2.

Change-Id: I4707089edc2c9203c2fc61779c1478c8ee8767e8
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id' for v21 compatible mode

There is difference in VIF list response for v2 and v2.1.
'net_id' attribute is not present in v2.1 VIF list response and
it was added as new microversion - Ic8b26df8d7e69bd71d23dfbc983fa3449c16fa7d

For v21 compatible mode we should have that attribute in response
same as v2.

This commit adds 'OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id' attribute in VIF list
response for v21 compatible mode.

NOTE - There is no change in v2.1 API.

Partial-Bug #1496664

Change-Id: I4707089edc2c9203c2fc61779c1478c8ee8767e8

commit_message:
Fix get_stats to return real used space in HNAS

Method get_stats was not considering other data, overheads or
snapshots in filesystem, just virtual-volumes quotas. With this
fix, it returns correctly usage of filesystem.

Closes-bug: #1494780
Change-Id: I5a7f9936f7aa6f308ee9e6360773a2934520b835

commit_message:
Move to the keystoneauth1 namespace

Conver from the keystoneauth namespace to keystoneauth1. This is to
ensure that is is possible to install all versions of keystoneauth
side-by-side.

Change-Id: Ibbaf11525980c8edb5968d8b8ee19c55094e77d8

subject: Pin oslo.utils < 1.4.1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 09:21:15.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Pin oslo.utils < 1.4.1

Few hours ago the new version of oslo.utils (1.4.1) has been released [1].
It has incompatible requirements for oslo.i18n, so we have to pin it
temporary until we up oslo.i18n version.

[1]: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/?id=1.4.1

Closes-Bug: #1496751

Change-Id: Ic2f13d0aa4a8e3c9d1744401113db8238c9d01a2
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>
'}]
commit_message:
Pin oslo.utils < 1.4.1

Few hours ago the new version of oslo.utils (1.4.1) has been released [1].
It has incompatible requirements for oslo.i18n, so we have to pin it
temporary until we up oslo.i18n version.

[1]: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/?id=1.4.1

Closes-Bug: #1496751

Change-Id: Ic2f13d0aa4a8e3c9d1744401113db8238c9d01a2
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>
